text: I usually drive all the way to poke express up north when i get my poke cravings.....not anymore, this place is great, the poke (i tried all) is fresh and awesome. The owners are very nice and it is conveniently located next to the Korean market at rainbow and spring mountain.

We order the wrong stuff because we didn't know it was raw fish which we didn't know but they refund us and they recommend something else, we ordered a new one with just pork and rice and it was so good, good customer service too

Being a noodle lover, I was disappointed with the noodles that came with the beef teriyaki.  The noodles weren't tasty,  didn't have green onions for flavor & color, although there were round onions.  The noodles only flavor was from the teriyaki sauce, which was overwhelming.  The teriyaki beef was very tasty, loved it!  The spaghetti salad & kim chee was good.
My mom had the kalua pig which she didn't care for.  They weren't chunky pieces, just little shreds.
She stated Lulu's kalua pig was better & their portions were generous.  She & my girlfriend said the poke & tako poke was ono.

Paina Cafe seems a bit hyped up for the food they have. Don't get me wrong, their bowls and poke were good! I just feel like it wasn't as good as I expected. I got the hawaiian poke bowl and hawaiian style tako poke. I personally think that their bowls are a little too pricey ($9.95). The hawaiian poke bowl came with kalua pig, lomi salmon, and spicy tuna (but you can choose whichever poke you want). Honestly, I expected much better than what I ate. It was good, but it felt like I was missing something to give it that "umph". I liked the tako poke and it had a nice spicy kick. I thought it would be more expensive, but I think the price was reasonable ($5.50 for 8 oz). I'll be back to try a different bowl and hopefully I'll like it more, but I know I'll definitely be back to buy some poke and even desserts!!

I have eaten at so many Poke Bowl restaurants, but this one is just as good as the flavors back home in Hawaii nei.  They offered items other than Poke to satisfy everyone's palate in our family of four.  The best part that complemented our meal was the ono desserts created by Ono Sweetz 702.  We tried every flavor of the tarts, the Ube flan roll, Mango bar, the Long John, and the Ube cream puff.  They were all so delicious and unique from the usual malasadas that we usually pick up when we roll into Las Vegas.  This will have to one of our stops when we visit Vegas twice a year.

Stopped by on a Tuesday for a spicy tuna bowl with avocado to go.  They have 2 sizes. Cold was still cold & rice warm.  It was sooooo good. I should have got the large! I'm writing this the next day because I'm still thinking about the deliciousness.

I've been here a few times.  They have desserts that is hard to find else where.  I've tried various tarts which were really good.  Different mochi flavors, I don't think you can find anywhere else unless you know somebody.  The food and poke itself was ok.
I come here 3 -4 times a week this is the best poke bowl in Las Vegas I have tried a few places here but paina cafe is by far the best owner is from Hawaii support local 808
If you want to experience the Aloha Spirit and real local food, check this place out!  Fresh Poki, great Katsu and the bakery -OHHH - the guava cake was amazing!  I drive 25 miles to go there...
OMG...my first time here and the dessert are good. We tried the ube puffs and the paina ube and it was so delicious. Will go back again when I come back to visit

This place is a gem. I don't know how they do it but their poke is really fresh! Better than most places in Los Angeles and we're closer to the ocean. Hawaiian ahi poke was perfectly seasoned as they can often be too salty. Prices are reasonable. The vibe of the restaurant is comforting aloha. They even have amazing cream puffs. I had an ube puff with rich thick custard and my husband had a coco chocolate. Best puffs I've ever eaten!
Awesome ! Great food , friendly staff , comfortable setting and well priced ! What more could you ask for ?

Paina Cafe is one of my go-to spots. From Sunday breakfasts to Lunches and dinners to midday mochi snacks, this place can satisfy my cravings. 

There breakfast is only available on Sunday mornings and how I wish this menu was available 24/7. The tsunami cakes (which I got with Ube custard sauce), is dense and fluffy at the same time. Since the pancakes are made with mochi powder, it gives the pancake a nice bounce to it. The Ube custard sauce is not overpowering and is creamy and just the right amount of sweetness. The Kalua Benny is also delicious. The pork is tender and flavorful, while the Yuzu Hollandaise sauce accents the pork well. The croissant it sits on is flaky and goes well with the pork as well. 

For lunch menu items, the Kalua pig bowl is delicious. It was a simple dish with shredded pork and rice; I wish the item came with some cabbage to have some veggies with the dish, but the pork was already great by itself. The Fried Saiman was also very good, with tender cuts of beef and delicious noodles. 

Paina cafe wins with all of their pastries. Though I still have many to try. I really enjoy their mango mochi. The mochi is sticky and the filling is not too sweet. Mochi is only sold on Monday, so make sure you check it out!
By far it might be one of the best poke places that we've tried in Las Vegas. The quality of the fish is very good and the staff are nice.
Very authentic and delicious style Hawaiian food! Made fresh daily and their pastries are to die for! Definitely a hidden treasure
The food was so delicious, I'm definitely coming here again. I got the Hawaiian poke bowl and I just love the simplicity of it. Also the desserts are so yummy as well.

U gotta try Paina Cafe! Good food, great service , and the desserts are to top it off! Staff are courteous and very friendly all around. If you're looking to eat some Hawaiian food stop here and try it you won't be disappointed at all... I love this place it's Quiet, casual and a local dining!

For the ppl that knows real good poke, gotta come here for it. Good poke, good atmosphere, aloha spirit from the staff, painted slippers on the ground in front of the door when you enter got me lol. Felt just like being back home in Hawaii. Loved it.

Their poke was ok. The flavors weren't there. It was missing something... They had four different types of flavors when I picked some up Christmas Eve. I got the ahi pokes. I also has a bowl a few months back and it was ok. I went to see what the hype was all about and was let down. It's ok and I would probably go if friends want to check it out, but it wouldn't be my first choice. Sorry guys.

This is place has the best poke in Vegas. The food is always so good. We went today and got the Hawaiian Poke bowl, ahi katsu bowl, a natto bowl, and a plain saimin. Everything tasted awesome. The ahi katsu is my wife's favorite thing on the menu. The pulehu tako is addicting. Now they have Samurai brand Hawaiian Frost too!

The people that run it are from Hawaii so they know how to make poke, not like some of the others.  They also have a some cooked plates for those that are not in raw fish.  Highly recommend the ahi katsu plate (its cooked).

This is a legit spot for poke. It has that island vibe. I definitely enjoyed the salmon one. Came back and tried masago, which wasn't as good as the salmon. But I'd still come back because the rice was bomb.

This review is for the amazing ube cream puffs and spam musubi. I was on vacation and found this place on Yelp. I came in late on a Sunday and of course they were out of ube cream puffs. They aren't guaranteed for weekdays so I decided to put in an order for pick up for the next morning before my flight to DC. I only wanted 6, but the woman informed me that my total was about $17 and it was $18 and change for 12 so I ended up ordering 12. They ask if you want to pay now or later. I tried them as soon as I picked them up and IT WAS DELICIOUS! There wasn't a strong ube flavor, but it was there. They tasted like heaven. The box that it came in was made for more than a dozen so they slid around a bit. I took the rest home and they made it through the 5 hour flight without spoiling. The spam musubi was flavorful and addicting. The people working there are friendly. I'd definitely revisit this place to try other stuff.

Delicious food and clean café! I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken plate and it absolutely satisfied my appetite and tastebuds!

I recommend giving this place a try without a doubt!
This place is a must try and try again. Staff is friendly and the food in on point. Poke is awesome. Go now, before this place gets crazy busy. Thanks again Paina. We'll be back soon.

this cafe is claiming to have "snow puffies"....
when in fact they are nothing but REPLICAS !!!  totally FAKE  and are NOTHING   like the original ones from 
Paalaa Kai Bakery on the North Shore!!!!!
so DIRTY.  The custard is so NASTY!!!
rename your "counterfeit" pastry...... Fakers!!!!!!!!

Finally the real poke has come to Las Vegas! This is the place for poke bowls. They have a lot to choose from, you can build your own or try one of their signature bowls.

 To build your own: 1st pick your size large or xlarge. 2nd choose your rice (White or Brown). 3rd choose your fish! ( They are all good ) Finally if you want extra toppings they are .60 each....

  The signature bowls are all A-Mazing!! The Ahi Katsu, beef bowl and Hawaiian poke bowl are winners! Try them all

  They have this Kamaboko dip (fish cake) that is to die for.

   Aloha is definitely spoken here, from the time you walk in to the time you roll out the door! Lol The atmosphere and the service is awesome. The owners are from Hawaii so they are super friendly and down to talk story. 

   Give this place a try and see why u will never go anywhere else for the poke fix!!! Happy eating...

We had ahi katsu plate and ube pastries.. sooo worth it! All tasted very fresh! They have friendly staff and cool, clean ambiance.  Even our baby was jamming to their island  beat background music  We will surely come back!

The ube cake was really good and the spam musubi. Place is nice would be back for sure to try the other sweets and menu they have... I just wish they serve the cake a little better in a plate or something

The poke bowls are tasty and filling. You can't go wrong with the best selling Hawaiian Bowl with your choice of poke, rice and also comes with kalua pork and lomi salmon. Then Katsu plate is also a hearty serving. The best part were their tarts. Must have more ube, choc haupia and guava! So delicious! The coco puff was okay. I guess you just can never compare any other coco puff next to Lililha. But it's sized to share and the chocolate is rich. Next time I'll be back for haupia bars and ube puffs!
"Locals" taking grindz to a different level ....  I fly into Vegas and insist that we make this one of the places to eat?

This review is only on the tarts.

I stopped by for lunch today and decided to try their tarts after reading the rave reviews on them. And I have to say I am not disappointed. 

I got 2 of their ube tarts and 1 chantilly tart (which is a chocolate filling) and they were both really yummy. The only complaint I have is they are tad bit on the pricey side ($1.40 for 1, $8.00 for 6). But other than that, I would recommend giving this place a try. 

Even though pricey, I'll definitely come back and try their other flavors!
Thank you for opening on this side  the Hawaiian bowl was delicious and service was great! Try them out!

Stopped here because it was on the way. My friend ordered poke With wasabi and sushimi I had the kalua pig bowl. Both were excellent. The cocoa puff was just like we had on the islands when we were there and the lilikoi and mango bar was amazing. We took an alpha pack of tarts to go. Everything was amazing. This stop is on our favorites of Vegas list now.
This place is super yummy! It is a cute place to have some great poke. The  kewalo bowl is a definite must. I will be back in no time with some hungry clients after seeing some houses!
Paina is my "go to" for poke bowl cravings!  Fast service, food on point and friendly service and atmosphere!  The "aloha spirit" is surely there!  Las Vegas hidden gem!! Live music too!!

This has become our go-to hangout lately when my friends and I are in the area.  The food is onolicious and the desserts they sell here are from OnoSweetz, which are soo good too!

Poke Crunch bowl is popular! And even though I have food allergy, I sneak and order this sometimes. So good! Ive been good though lately and get Kalua bowl. It's pretty simple and good too. Bummer no more Sunday brunch for the public. It's too bad, especially after all that yummy preparation and hype I saw on IG. 

NIce laid back vibe. The staff always full of aloha no matter how long we visit or just drop in for desserts.

Oh man oh man oh man. In the midst of all the other "build your own" poke bowls popping up all throughout the west coast, Paina Cafe stands high above the rest. Prior to visiting, Pokinometry in Anaheim was my favorite poke bowl place. But this, this place is the real deal. (And I guess that's pretty obvious, since this place came from Hawaii lol)

The process is very simple. You walk up to the counter on the left and place your order. There are desserts in a glass display that you can choose from. They also had spam musubi when we went, but I did not see it on the menu. You give them your name and wait for it to be called. Easy peasy. 

Since it was our first time, my boyfriend and I opted for the preset bowls: a regular nanea salmon poke bowl and large kewalo bowl. You got to choose white or brown rice. We also had the option to choose two types of poke in our bowls. They also have options to make your own. AND they sell poke in containers to go too. YES YES YES. I love masago, and I love that they were so generous with their masago topping. The kewalo bowl sauce (pretty sure it had wasabi) WAS SO GOOD. I felt like my salmon poke bowl was way too heavy on the raw onion though. 

I am definitely going to come here again because there are so many things on the menu!! I do think the prices are a little steep, but hey, the food is bomb. All in all, this place is jam packed with authentic flavors, and I'm thinking it's my favorite poke place to date.
From bowls and plates to desserts... perfection! Really liked the ube tarts!!! Will come back for them!

Great, good quality ahi tuna and salmon over rice with Kim Chee... the best.  It is lacking in space however and it is a tad slow (so you really wouldn't call it "fast food") but the service and quality is excellent!
Love the Paina Ube and Poke Bowl. Would definitely come back for more. Love the Hawaiian vibe.

Great poke place, very tasty like the Paina Cafes back home. The poke hits the spot when you're craving for local Hawaiian delights. Owner is very friendly and nice. Definitely will return! 

We were sad that they ran out of cream puffs, but hey, it'll make us come back again soon!

Great food, desserts, and environment! Their chicken katsu is my #1 choice and when available, ube pancakes. The only minor thing I have to say is that they should check the trash more often. Other than that everything is perfect! This place is amazing and I wish them continuous success.

Bad food and cheap on toppings:( 
Fish not fresh and one free topping 
More topping is0.75$ per topping plus10.45 price already being charged.

Omg!!!! Wow I never use Omg but this place is one of the greatest. I can even remember what I got but it was great. Wife enjoyed hers and son loved his. Pricey but well worth it. Next time I go there I'll tell you about what I got.

We came here with high expectations, sad the Aloha all gone when we arrived their, high makapiapia kine style junk that kine vibe. I'd give them a 1 star but gotta be nice cause the bakers are actually good friends with the Ohana. . . . 
We keep hearing about how good this place was and this and that. . . . very simple menu which is good and food was simple and good. Just step up the customer service and no treat us like retards and look at us weird because as our 1st time there, you lose customers like that. 
So after we ate we figured gotta get the desserts of course as the only reason why we literally came in. So i picked my selections and watch the boy boxed it up for me. . . . was going call um out like seriously. . . . podagee style he went wrap my precious desserts up, like hello. . . no even make um fit but then i was sooo patiently waiting and couldn't wait to write my review because i was standing next to my uncle watching this boy wrapping everyone elses goodies and he wrapped theirs all perfect and when came to mines ayye aye SmfH. .   i just show you the picture instead and you be the judge of that, being that the baker work soooo hard to extend her passion to them she is phenomenal . . . .

Great food, great service and great atmosphere! So glad Paina Cafe expanded to Las Vegas.

Located in a strip mall next to Greenland Supermarket, the restaurant is bright, welcoming and their menu offers a variety. From poke bowls, to sandwiches and salads.

I highly recommend the ahi katsu bowl. It's basically ahi (fish) coated lightly in bread crumbs and fried, not too greasy or too dry. Served over brown or white rice, with additional sides of your choosing. Very good and filling!

The kamaboko (fishcake) dip is done just right. Not too rich, not too heavy, but still flavorful.

Currently, my favorite menu item is the pulehu tako (dried octopus), mostly because it reminds me of something my grandfather used to make. It's not too chewy, not too dry, and the sauce adds a little bit of heat. I've had similar items from other places here in Vegas, but nothing comes close. I had to exercise extreme constraint not to eat the entire container in one sitting.

Regardless if you're from Hawaii or not, they have something for everyone. I'm from Hawaii so some of what I ordered may seem unusual (like the kamaboko dip), because you don't find it on menus here in town. But back home, you'll find it at potlucks and family gatherings any day of the week. 

Highly recommend and definitely going back again soon!

Located on spring mt and rainbow next to Greenland! 

My favorite poke spot right now! It definitely has the home vibe to it. Being from Hawaii it's hard finding a good poke place that lives up to expectations. I have yet to try the other options as today was my time, but I got the kewalo bowl. It contained furikake, spicy shoyu (they also have regular kine), onions, white or brown rice, and ahi poke. The poke tasted fresh and everything blended perfectly together! I believe it's around $9-10 bucks for the regular size. They also give a good sized portion! A lot of poke places really lack portion and wanna be very cheap on the fish. This place will give you a good amount. I also got to try my girlfriends salmon poke and it was good and smooth like buttahhhh. 

Overall I will be back soon to try their other options. Specifically I wanna try the ahi katsu bowl that one sounded bomb! The staff is friendly and the place is clean with a good amount of seating.

Paina brings the original Hawaiian style poke bowl to Vegas! Though there are many poke bowl spots opening around town, all the native Islanders have been quick to point out that they're not the real thing- Paina is. 

The poke flavors at Paina are traditional and fish-forward; there is actual Hawaiian poke in your bowl rather than just fish and sauce. If you're used to the usual overly-sauced fish bowls with tons of toppings, you may find these underwhelming- note that each topping comes with a 60-cent charge. You can also purchase the pokes by weight to take home, keep an eye out for the tako poke, which sells out!

The Nanea salmon bowl was the first one I tried, followed by the Hawaiian bowl, which combines hot and cold protein with lomi and kalua pork with your choice of poke.  The fish is fresh and flavorfully marinated, and the fish quality is higher than their competition. The ahi katsu Caesar salad was also an interesting menu item; the protein portion goes further than it looks and crisp Romaine and flaky parmesan add a lot of texture. 

Bonus star for partnering with OnoSweets for fancy Hawaiian-influenced desserts, like strawberry mochi, ube tarts (love!), and matcha roll cakes. Definitely plan on having something sweet to end your meal!

Ordered their Hawaiian Poke Bowl that has kalua pig, rice, lomi salmon and choice of poke which I picked the Hawaiian style poke.  It was ono (delicious) I topped it off with pickle onions, kim chee and takuan.

Tried their desserts today. The ube tart is overrated, not flavorful basically just sweet custard with bright color, while their passion fruit tart is delightful with a great combination of sweet and tart, soft and crunchy. Other tarts are good too, all worth trying. The green tea custard is very matcha and it's awesome. I got the ube cake roll as well, cake part is great, again the ube custard, along with the Chantilly custard, not very impressive. The Aloha tower (not sure if it's exactly the name, it's banana pound cake, cream and Chantilly custard) the banana pound cake is very good. The other one I got is the Haupia bar, it's good, period. Overall the desserts are decent, will go back and try other items. Big disappointment for the ube custard but it's not the cafe that advertised the ube is crazy good. I didn't expect the chantilly custard to be too special anyways cuz it's basically just butter sugar egg and milk, and that's what the ube flavor tastes like, maybe if you try really hard, you can taste some starch. I mean what was I expecting, ube is just potato with a different color, don't expect it to be something too magical guys, sweet potato is better.

First time trying Pa'ina Cafe... lived in HI for 20 years and haven't even tried it there either. So I finally decided to drive all the way across town and try it since the sister and I were craving poke.

The atmosphere of this place is super cute and hip, I love the canvases throughout the store that add a touch of Hawaii to the store. The menu is pretty self explanatory but I felt like it was not what I was expecting. I had the spicy ahi bowl and would probably rate it a little more on the spicy side compared to spicy ahi I've had. 

You do get a great amount of fish for the price of the bowl, but I dislike how they charge you an additional 60 cents per topping... I didn't end up adding toppings anyway because I felt like it took away from the poke. Another plus would be that they serve it with just plain white or brown rice and not sushi rice; I hate it when poke places give you sushi rice (it's a poke bowl not a sushi bowl). 

They also have a variety or desserts to choose from like chantilly tarts and ube tarts which looked delicious. I am definitely putting this on list the next time I visit. 

This place is clean, cute, food is good, and the customer service is great.

This review is for the bakery portion of the cafe. I am so thoroughly pleased that I ordered for my good friends birthday I ordered a custom cake as well as two dozen white cupcakes the day before and they were so friendly in communicating everything. 

Highly recommend the bakery! Will be back to try to poke!

I'm giving this place a 4 stars based off of their loco moco. The beef patty had a strange sweetness to it. My boyfriend and I finished both of our loco mocos, regardless. But we both agreed that it probably would've tasted better if the entire dish was savory, not sweet. Heck, I had to add shoyu to my beef patty to drown out the sweetness I was tasting.

But otherwise. The poke here is TO DIE FOR. It's my favorite place now in Vegas to get fresh, quality poke. The Shoyu poke and the Spicy Ahi are my favorites. I definitely want to try the other flavors.

And I will for sure be back to feed my inner diabetic. I want to try those beautiful pancakes and desserts. And of course practically everything else on the menu, lol. 

I have faith in you, Paina! So far, so good.

Food was good but not a lot of options. The rice substitute was only normal lettuce. There are no options to add vegetables or other proteins.
It was not like other poke places I've tried before. Still yummy though!
Found on Yelp, ordered salmon poke, watery sauce and lacking flavor, 30 % poke are onion, disappointed wont return.
I love poke and Paina is consistently delicious!....my favorite is a spicy tuna  crunch bowl with garlic chips

The reason I'm giving it a 4 star is because I haven't tried EVERYTHING  on their menu and the sweets. Other than that, the atmosphere is quite laid back and refreshing (I feel like I'm in Oahu when I stepped into the establishment). The staff were friendly, efficient, and easy to converse with. The price is reasonable since the bowls will fill you up.

I definitely want to try the sweets next time since I always have a sweet-tooth.
I've came back a few times and the food is just like home but... the employees really don't seem to want to be there. What makes a business flourish is customer service. Where's da ALOHA???

My absolute favorite spot when you're craving a poke bowl. Came in and got a poke crunch bowl w spicy tuna. The poke, toppings, and rice is perfect! Other places you get really good poke but shitty rice. But no not this place! It comes in small and large sizes. Obviously I got the large. I just gotta say, when you take your first bite, make sure you get a little bit of everything, soooo delicious
Snow Puffies in Vegas! Multiple layers of flakey thin crispy buttery sheets filled with creamy cool custard! Delicious! I thought I'd have to fly back to Hawaii just to have these again

My SO has been on the fence about where to go on vacation this year, he was leaning towards London, I was wanting to go back to Hawaii.  Now I can't guarantee these results for everyone, but in my situation, it took just 3 kinds of poke from here to remind him of how much he loves Hawaii and well, you can expect to see Kauai reviews from me later this year. 

I've stopped in several times for dessert and you can really feel the Aloha spirit. All the employees I've encountered have been so friendly, and didn't even mind my butchered pronunciations. 

We have had the Moana Roll, the Ube Flan Roll, Shaka cake, and a variety of the Hawaiian style tarts. Everything has been delicious - the ube flan roll might be the best cake I've ever had. It's so light and fluffy, and the filling is to die for! 

Obviously my husband thoroughly enjoyed his poke, so I look forward to trying more of their food items in the future.

The Poke Bowl ride made another stop at one of the newer ones Paina Cafe. Unlike all the ones before Paina Cafe definitely STANDS out lot for different reasons. Not that I will stop my endless journey because seems like every month another poke spot pops out. Paina Cafe is my GO TO spot comes to local grinds. Why I went back try more of the menu and so much more of the menu need to try. I just might need make run after write this review.

My first visit went off the beaten path went with the Ahi Katsu and two orders side action  spam musubi. The Ahi Katsu basically chicken katsu style just with fish. It was awesome. The panko style crust was nice golden brown and the ahi was cooked through on point. It was not dried out at all (just in case thinking ahi cooked all the way..huh) nice moist and then combine with the sauce on top. You can add any amount of toppings want some of them vary in price. I went with kim chee because love kim chee. Kim chee and the spam musubi the perfect compliment. The spam musubi they add furikake into the rice. So not just straight rice looking at it. Nice touch because not everyone does it that style. Spam musubi is universal everyone does it there own way. End the beauty of it is spam, nori, and rice. WInnah!!!

Second visit had go with the tradition some poke action. I was not sure Hawaiian style, shoyu, or spicy? I always go for spicy poke more times then not. Poke Crunch Bowl. Another winnah!! The fish always standard comes Poke make or break. The fish looked fresh nice color, tasted fresh, not fatty at all, and nice square pieces (unlike other spots on the ride hate it when minced up and not nice dice cause true POKE lover know the difference). Add kim chee shocker. The kim chee not sure if make it or buy it. I could just have bowl of the kim chee be set. It not spicy spicy kim chee but just the right amount of kick. Also add masago not only adds great color and makes for great pic. I love the added texture plus the depth adds to the dish. The crunch of the little fried tempura batter, masago, and spicy tuna. Heavenly. The mac salad sort of traditional. They add spaghetti noodles. I have had before give mac salad twist. The star of the show is the poke action for me. 

The menu...stands out is the diversity. Not just like every other poke/burrito bowl. It so so much more. They have kalua pig bowl and beef bowl. Course not just tuna, salmon, and tako. Unlike other spots enjoy and appreciate being from 808. The poke action is legit poke action. It none of this pick your sauce or two just over kill not let the fish stand out. Good poke is all about quality fish. Paina Cafe got u covered. All the poke forgot the bowl just order it by the half pound action or pound. I could have gone there but wanted more full meal with white rice and add some extra toppings. I have not even tapped the menu and look forward to my next visit. 

The interior decor big fan of it. It feels like own style. 808 style for sure!! Some poke places chain multiple locations. Great about this one couple local boys believe owners this only one. The minute you walk in with the slippah action. Scream local style take your slippah off before go into someone house. The hawaiian flag, some of the signs, and the artwork. All the Aloha brand shoyu action. The vibe when you walk in truly got aloha spirt. 

Everyone that works there super cool, friendly, next thing know talking stories like where you from, and again aloha spirit. The music got local hawaiian music chill playing the whole time. 

No doubt. Hot and new Paina Cafe deserves the shout out. I look forward next visit thinking hawaiian style poke.

My sole purpose to come to Paina Cafe is for their deserts, period. And that's why I give this place 5 Stars, sorry Paina 

So, I have eaten once here before and for me the food was eh, I guess it wasn't the worst food but definitely not the greatest food either. I love the environment, decor and the people are always nice however, I was not impressed by their food. Although I have seen that they had brunch and it looks yummy, I've yet to try it. Maybe one day

If you LOVE Hawaiian deserts like I do? LoL. (And if you never tried them? What are you waiting for? You're missing out man! Haha) you should definitely try Ono Sweetz deserts (check their instagram @onosweetz) Her cakes and deserts are beautiful and soooooo delicious. 

I absolutely LOVE their tartes. You can buy tartes individually for I believe $1.40 a piece, 6pk for $8 and a 12pk for $15 and you can mix the flavors, so you're able to try each of them. Today I got a 6pk with Haupia [coconut chocolate],Chocolate Macadamia, Paradise[Passion fruit] and my favorite Ube. Yummy!

They have different deserts to choose from. Tartes[comes in different flavors], ube rolls[comes in different flavors], Mango/Haupia Bars, flavored Cakes like Passion fruit, Haupia Pie parfaits and many more. Just keep in mind that some of the deserts do change, so you may not see certain ones twice. 

But definitely check out the deserts. Like I said, food was okay. I wish they upped their food game b/c they can do so much more!

I have a hard time finding good poke places that are just like home (Hawaii). I finally found one! I'm eating the spicy tuna, salmon bowl with pickled onions and it's...O N O!! This is definitely my new go to spot for poke! Also if you have a sweet tooth, you gotta have a haupia puff!!

This is my go to place for Poke bowls with its authentic flavors that remind me of home.  I recently had the ahi Katsu and it was on point.  Love the toss green salad option instead of rice along with the pickled veggies and potato salad.  Also enjoyed the Hawaiian style tako poke.  Ono grinds every visit.
Good eats- they have the best chicken tankatsu and fried saimin. Serve hot and fresh. Food is delicious , moist, and tasty. Place looks cozy and clean. Well recommended. Will come back for sure.

Great place to have Hawaiian style Poke...
The place is bright, airy, and clean. Nice island music too...
The poke is really good. The choices the style of Poke is limited but it is good.
The dessert was great too. The prices are reasonable and I will be back.

My poke bowl go to place. The first time I brought my husband here he said this place better be good. Poke bowls aren't the same here like back in Hawaii. They did not disappoint! now all the boys from the dealership coming here for lunch at least once a week. Yes it's that good!!
Great food and amazing service! Jayse provided quality, top-notch customer service :) we'll definitely be back!!
All i can say is the deserts are simply AMAZING!!!! Coming back again!

I've been here three times this week because it is THAT good! I'm so glad an authentic Hawaiian poke spot has finally opened. This place serves fresh tuna over the perfect bed of rice. The sauces to choose from are also very well seasoned. I would highly recommend the Paina Bowl and the Ahi Katsu Bowl!
Awesome deserts! Poké bowls galore!! What else can I say? A must visit for any occasion

I just got back from Hawaii last week and I was craving Kalua pork baaad. I drove about 35 minutes there and back and it was totally worth it! Huge portions and the ahi poke is delicious as well. Staff is super nice too!

The best Hawaiian food place I've ever been in vegas... place is small cozy and clean. I strongly recommend their spam musubi, their different tarts and puffs..everything is heaven! I love this place!

My review is solely for the Hawaiian desserts that they sell in the store. 

- Guava Long John: donut with chantilly creme and two strips of guava inside and out lengthwise, with powdered sugar on top. This one was my favorite out of the bunch. The guava was very flavorful and was wonderfully paired with the soft donut. 

-Ube creme puff: creme puff with Uber filling and purple creme on top. This looked better than it tasted. The creme puff tasted dry and I wouldn't be surprised if it was a couple days old. The purple creme filling on top was hard and unpleasant to eat.

-Choco creme puff: creme puff with chocolate filling topped with chantilly. I liked this better than the ube creme puff. The chocolate filling was literally a chocolate pudding. It oozed out of the creme puff as it was sliced. Paired up nicely with the chantilly creme on top. This creme puff was more moist than the ube creme puff.

-Paina Roll: ube sponge cake rolled between layers of chantilly. This dessert was mediocre. I didn't taste any ube flavor, only sponge cake with sweet creme. 

As you can already tell, they have a very common theme among their desserts: chantilly--sweet whipped creme. Mostly all of their desserts will have this incorporated one way or another. Aside from the vibrant purple color, the ube desserts weren't impressive. They also sell tarts in the refrigerator on the side. I was hoping I would like their desserts enough to come back for the tarts but I don't think that will be happening.
Don't say you're closed @ 8PM, when you close your kitchen @ 7PM! LOSE MONEY DOING IT THAT WAY!

This review is based on their dessert, Ube Tart by Ono Sweetz 702. It is unbelievable. There was only one left, so I had to try it. So glad I did.

It looks plain jane, but my oh my, my my my.. one bite is all it took for me to love this dessert. It's really that incredible. It's like an egg custard, but better. A light chilled, refreshing bite of Ube. What more can you ask for?! Maybe a dozen more pleeeeeease!!! Yes yes yes. 

For something that looks so simple, but made a huge impact in texture and taste.. hands down to the pastry Chef. Definitely made up for my belated Lunar New Year celebration with my Family. Now that was a sweet success!!! Can't wait to try more dessert goodies and creations :D

The cashier is really friendly and helpful with the menu. I got a regular poke bowl which really fresh. 

The restaurant is simple and peaceful. I didn't try their cute Hawaiian dessert. But they look very cute, will definitely try it next time.

I was SO utterly excited that this cafe made "paina puffies" aka paalakai bakery snow puffies on the north shore of Oahu! 

So excited that I drove all the way from my house in Henderson to Greenland! Talk about journey! 

Anywho, upon arriving I immediately spot the snow puffies and I ever so excitedly ask...how much are the puffies?!? With a big smile on my face. 

Then she says..$2.75 (with the sassiest look on her face) but sees me pointing at the snow puffies and she says $3.75 basically giving me her snotty look while I'm smiling cheek to cheek  

So, two things are going through my head.. this girl has the worst customer service skills and damn! That's expensive for a small version of the real paalakai bakery pastries!

Initially I wanted to buy a dozen for the fam but that would be $45 for 12 pastries. I asked if they had special pricing if we are buying a dozen and the said nope.

Hell to the no was I going to pay $45 for 12 pastries. I ended up buying one and it was ok.... not worth $3.75!

Spicy tuna bowl and lillikoi.... how can you go wrong with that? This place has the freshest fish and the poke is the real deal just like home! Their chantilly coco puffs are also just like liliha bakery. All my locals from Hawaii, if you haven't tried this place yet then you must!!!

Technically 2.5, their signature bowls are quite plain. I ordered #1, 2, and 3. It's just rice, onion, and sauces up sashimi. The rice  doesn't taste like authentic sushi rice.

On the bright side, the fish quality is pretty good.

It was about three years ago this past summer that we "discovered" the Paina Cafe while getting off on the wrong bus stop taking it back to Waikiki from the Aloha Bowl Swapmeet. We were starving, didn't know where we were, but the scent of the ocean banging off the boats docked in the marina behind us ping ponged their way through our nasal passages onto our taste buds and begged us for fish. So, we consulted Yelp and it took us across the street to a little shopping center and just like that, we met and fell in love with poke.

So, how awesome was it to see listed under the "Hot and New" section or whatever it's called that the Paina Cafe was up and running here in the 9th island called Las Vegas? I thought it was too good to be true but we came anyway. And it was a good thing too, because although all the traffic coming and going through the door of this tiny establishment was brown-faced like mine, they were the faces of my Hawaiian brothers and sisters, which could only mean one thing: this was real deal Hawaiian!

Paina Cafe LV, DID NOT DISAPPOINT! I had the large Poke Crunch Bowl ($11.25) with my choices of brown rice and Spicy tuna, which were served with their special teri glaze blend, shredded nori, and topped with crispy tempura flakes. I added avocado and crispy garlic chips for an extra 60 cents for each topping. I asked the young lady behind the counter for chili water, and at first she said they didn't have any but she'd double check in the back, and she did, and it must've been from their secret, private stash, but she kicked me down with it and I really appreciated it.

Since the young lady was so helpful, we asked her if it was connected to the one in Honolulu, and she confirmed it was. To sum it up, I don't know what they do to their fish, but it was like poke crack! It was SOOOOOOOOO GOOOOD! It tasted like it was fresh off the boat, and I'm glad they opened one up in Vegas because now I have another "must eat" spot on my places to eat when we hit up Vegas.

As if though I never left home. Everyone had the aloha spirit and the Hawaiian poke bowl with shoyu ahí poke was very ono! The music choices (island music) only added to a very laid-back atmosphere. The desserts are hard to choose, but I did eventually get the ube paina and the mango passion cheesecake. Both deserts were ono and added the finishing touch to the meal. 

If anyone is looking for a place to have some island style poke bowl with some ono desserts to top it off,...and you happen to live on the Summerlin or Spring Valley side of The Valley and going to Henderson is not an option,....then this is the place to go!

I just had the best taste of Da Island while in Vegas!  Amazing food, and this is a place that the locals love!  It reminds me of home.  I happily watched as customer after customer came in and ordered their favorites.  Non stop.  Great service, happy customers and delicious food.  It absolutely doesn't get better than this.  I'll be back and think you'll love it too.  Any true Hawaiian will enjoy!

So Ono......

Seriously the best Hawaiian Poke place I have tried so far in Las Vegas. Other places don't marinate their fish and still call it poke, but Paina Cafe  marinates their fish and makes it more Hawaiian style. 

I always get their Salmon Poke, and the price varies but it is usually around $10 including tax. You can also get their poke by oz without rice and toppings and that is usually around $8 including tax for 8oz Salmon and Ahi Tuna. Their Ahi Tuna is okay, but it is not as good as Salmon, and they get their 5 stars because their salmon is so good. 

Paina marinates their salmon in soy sauce and what taste like ponzu (but I don't know for sure) with onions and other stuff, and it really brings out the flavor. Also, because it is marinated the poke doesn't have a fishy scent either. When you take a bite in to the salmon poke, you get all the deep flavors and the salmon is so tender it will melt off your mouth. 
I do have to include that their rice is not cooked all the way sometimes and that you can crunch into your rice. That only happened twice, but that is why I get their poke by oz not the whole meal. 

Paina also serves some great Hawaiian treats such as ube rolls and pastries and even snow puffies when you order beforehand. The ube rolls are delicious, but I am not really into sweet pastries. However, if you really love pastries I recommend it!

Their service is also great! And what I love about this place is that service is pretty fast. That having said, try Paina cafe rather than some mediocre poke places that costs just as much.

Wonderful customer service and delicious food! You can't go wrong here. If you want an authentic poke bowl, this is the place to go! Don't forget to pick up dessert as well... a little pricey but delicious!
This place is hard to find. A small shop next door to Greenland Market.  Had the 3 choice poke bowl with Poke, Lomi Lomi Salmon, and Kalua Pig over rice. Good but would have liked bigger portions.

Finally, a place in the States that doesn't just give you "Poke Salad". Sick and tired of places giving you more Salad than Fish. In Hawai'i, it just Poke(with selected toppings) and rice. Great tasting, "Authentic" Poke served here and love their places back home in Hawai'i. If you want Poke from peeps that know what they are doing come here.

So happy I found a place that has my snack that I crave! Spam Masubi!!
I bought two.  $5
I will have to come back and try the rest of the menu. 
Love Hawaiian food and culture. 
Happy days!

Been there four.  This will be my new go-to spot for poke..  Fish is fresh and prices are good.  Only minus is selection is a little smaller than other places, but quality trumps the other places by a lot.  Minus Poke Express, don't go anywhere else now.  They also have a good selection of Hawaiian pastries.  This place is ono.

I've been craving poke for such a long time I was stoked to stumble upon this place. I went there this morning and had the Hawaiian bowl with the spicy ahi tuna. Order came out in less than five minutes. The portions are filling and the ingredients taste fresh.

I really dig the interior. There's a lot of decor that makes you feel like you're in the islands with signs that say 'keep calm and surf on', a tv that repeatedly plays surfing videos and so on.

I'm giving 4 stars to  Paina for the poke and because it is so cozy, service is great and food is fresh. The fifth star was earned because of  Ono Sweets extraordinary deserts. Or as AM/PM would say "toucj good stuff"

I'm not kidding when I say - if I checked in every time I came here, I'd be the queen of this place. I love Pa'ina cafe. The friendly staff and ono food make it worth the 25-minute drive to get here...literally almost every week. When you walk into Pa'ina - you instantly feel home. Which is perfect, considering that the name literally means "gathering place". The food is delicious and the desserts are some of the greatest you can find. Some of them come with a hefty price tag, especially if you're like me and buy multiple,  but it's definitely worth the indulgence. 

Here is a review of todays meal:

Sunday Morning Brunch : Loco Moco with Mushroom Gravy. Definite A- ; the flavor of the patty itself is amazing, combined with a beautiful shiitake gravy and egg, the brunch special is a winner. I could certainly do without the chili flakes though. I'll opt-out of that next time.

Spicy Ahi: Pa'ina Cafe is definitely one of Las Vegas' best poke spots. It doesn't get much closer to being in Hawai'i than this.

Combined with Chef Annette's amazing desserts - you can't go wrong. Todays featured desert was a strawberry tart that is literally to die for. Desserts vary every day, so if I'm looking for something in particular, I always call first to see what they have for the day. You can also pre-order all that she has to offer through email. Check out OnoSweetz702 on instagram guys! You'll thank me later ;) I've ordered from her for at least 5 different occasions - and I've never been disappointed.

I came specifically to get some tarts as a little souvenir for my housemates back in Omaha (we're all from O'ahu). I had seen pictures of the ube tart on Yelp at both Paina Cafe and Hi-Coffee Cafe and tried tracking down the source (Ono Sweetz 702). After some intensive research, I managed to contact Annette, the mastermind behind the goods. She informed me that she no longer sells to Paina and Hi-Coffee and instead takes online orders. Unfortunately, I was leaving in a few hours and we agreed it'd be cutting it too close to place an order at the time since she makes everything to order. She suggested I head over to Paina as she personally trained them on her recipes.

I decided on two each of the ube, Iilikoi/guava, chocolate haupia, and chantilly tarts ($1.40 each). I also picked up an ube flan roll and a coco puff ($2.95 each) to share with a friend.

My favorite was the ube flan roll. Although the outside was a little dry from being refrigerated, the inside was soft and had a light sweet potato flavor. Huge fan of the flan and ube cream in the roll. Coco puff (cream puff with chocolate filling and chantilly frosting on top) was yummy. I'm not too big on cream puffs, but I could go for another one of these. My friend who has had Liliha Bakery's (home of the OG coco puff) said it's pretty similar, except Paina's is like twice the size. Also ended up trying some of the tarts I brought back haha. They were pretty good, but not worth $1.40 for such a small treat (especially when Annette sells a dozen for $10)!

Paina had a good selection of the tarts left around 2PM, but I was kind of disappointed with the selection they had of the other pastries. I didn't see the Moana roll, matcha/ube cream puff, or guava cake (all of which I wanted to try after seeing pictures of on Yelp). I highly recommend ordering through Annette herself if you can (give her minimum 2 days notice) as it will be FRESH (who knows how long it's been sitting in the display at Paina) and CHEAPER. If not, Paina will do.
Poke bowl taste just like from home. The dessert tarts were super good. We'll be retuning!

Downside is that toppings are 60 cents each. That's something that I'm not used to since there are so many other places that offer unlimited topping choices included in the price. 

Very chill music playing in the background and there's a beachy theme going on. There are 5 tables that can seat 4 people each and a larger one in the middle with single seats as well along the wall. 3 different types of soy sauce are on the table: original, premium and low sodium. 

Then build your own bowls are $9.45 for a regular and $10.45 for a large. The small is pretty small so get a large for a dollar more. Their poke choices are spicy tuna, shoyu ahi tuna, wasabi masago ahi tuna, Hawaiian style ahi tuna, soy ginger salmon, sweet chili tofu poke, and two other interesting choices. With each additional topping costing $0.60, the price of a build your own bowl can add up pretty quickly.  I recommend ordering pre set bowls. 

My sister ordered the kewalo bowl which came with white or brown rice, choice of poke with shoyu or hot shoyu with a wasabi mayo drizzle, shredded nori, radish sprouts and red onions. The wasabi added a nice kick to the bowl and wasn't too strong. The ahi tuna was well seasoned and firm, not mushy unlike a few other poke places I've been to. 

Service is great, and workers are super friendly and helpful here. Food came out really quickly too.

Was treated to this complimentary lunch plate from Paina Cafe. Fried Saimin Mix Plate with Bulgogi and Kim Chee. 
Flavor was on point, meat extremely tender. 

Finished it off with some delicious sweet treats from Ono Sweetz. Really enjoyed this place. They do pokè too, that's what I'm gonna go back for next to try

Love this place one off my favorite.  everything is just right always fresh! Clean place good music and staff are nice  very quickly they make your order and dessert are bomb I try the puff balls they the the best.

The long johns, kulolo, coco puff and uber roll!! Superb deserts!! The place is very clean and friendly employees. The flavor of the foods are unbelievable and phenomenal!! I would recommend this place to anyone. Owner is very friendly, personable and humble.

Our favorite place to get poke! The poke is always fresh. Our favorite is the Crunch Bowl with spicy tuna. This time we tried their Paina Roll and it was so good! .. so good that I couldn't stop raving about how happy it was making me lol.

This place opened up near my home and was so excited to try it. The BEST poke bowl in town! The poke is fresh and whatever is in the spicy ahi poke...delish! I always order the spicy ahi poke and add sea weed salad and nori flakes on top. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is one of my visits they ran out of spam musubi and white rice :( disheartening since it was a Sunday afternoon, where you'd think those items are a staple. Anyhow, still my favorite poke spot!
My new poke place! The poke was fresh and delicious, restaurant was clean and cute, the ube puffs are life!!!
I tried fried asinine was so delish and I tried the teriyaki steak plate dam was so delish I am telling everyone to go and try this new place so delish mahalo for the great service and food the best

My friend and I went there for the first time and found it welcoming and delicious. We both ordered the Hawaiian Bowl, one with ahi and the other with salmon. The  Hawaiian Bowl is a combination bowl that is good to sample a little of everything for the first time.

The amount of combinations that you can create are numerous and exciting to try something different each time.

You can tell by sight and smell that the food is very high quality and fresh, especially the Kalua  Pork, that brings you back to the beautiful island of Hawaii.

The prices are very reasonable.

I want to give this place 4 stars, but I just can't do it. The food tastes great. I would say 4 stars for taste. The fried saimin I ate was yummy. The spicy tuna inari was really good too. But the value just isn't there for me. 2 stars for value. For the price I paid, I would expect a bigger portion.

Only had poke on its own, and it was the freshest I have tasted here in Vegas. Appreciate that it was made to order (not dished out of a container in a deli display). I tried two - a salmon and a tuna. The tuna was simpler and delicious, but I enjoyed the salmon more. You can't go wrong here. Excellent choice!

Truth: Yelp pictures cause contagiousness.  Keep seeing those ube tart pictures and I was getting anxious to try them.  Didn't get here early enough though; they're so popular.  Went with the Kona ones.  NO REGRETS! 

But why you gotta lure me with all these unique desserts?!  Oh dreams... the Haupia bar.  I was just thinking what a perfect wedding cake that would make.  The coconut jelly-like layer with flakes... puts me in a moment... Very nice flavor with the sweetest part of it, caramel.  I wonder if they make the purple sweet potato Haupia.

Moana roll :) whoa totally not expecting the mango flavor.  At least that's what we think it is.  Cuz the bold happy colors in it throw off the mind set.  It's a fun cake roll.  Would make a great kids' cake!

Checked out the poke bowls too.  These were okay.  Already flavored like so no picking your sauces.  Got the brown rice large bowl with Spicy tuna, Hawaiian style ahi poke, Masago, Crunchy Nori, and Avocado.  Only thing that made me :/ is their large bowl only allows 2 poke choices. (4.25****)

Would return for sure for more Haupia bars and yeah gotta see if I can get there earlier for the ube tarts.

I ordered the shoyu poke bowl and fried noodles (not on menu) while the boyfriend had the Paina bowl. The fried noodles had kimchi on the side and something like a potato salad. Both of our orders were amazing. And we had these desserts (ube, chocolate cream puff, and banana flavored one) to take home careof the amazing owner, Kip. Everything was honestly so superb. Customer service and food are great. Thumbs way up!

Very good tried the poke crunch bowl while my car gets cleaned in the same center  I would have expected better greeting do to it being a Gawain place but food is still excellent customer service is okay .

Pretty awesome poke bowls here. I bought a couple of bowls to go and everybody loved it. I also picked up a bento box for work (not sure what it's called) and had it for lunch the next day. It was spicy poke and rice in a tofu pocket on a bed of limu salad. Oh my goodness! It was da bomb! I think I found my new favorite place! **The long johns are delicious also!

UPDATE: I went in today 3/31/18 @3:38pm. I'm giving it a 1 Star because the tall, young guy who worked at the front counter was the most unhappy, depressed, sad, impersonal person I've ever seen. I was the only customer in there and 2 of the females were taking their break at the table next to the refrigerator. When he was taking my order, he looked like he didn't want to be there nor wanted to take my order. I made my order right away, it's not like I stood there and stared at the menu....I go there all the time and always order my usual: Kawalo bowl etc. I wanted to ask for his name so I can post it but I figured his name would be on the receipt. Unless his name is 'Ashley S',  I think that guy probably logged in as another name so customers like I can't call him out. 

Management- PLEASE take care of this!!!

Being from Hawaii I have a specific type of taste buds for poke and no offense to any other poke bowl place but yall ain't got shhhh on paina!!! Theres just something about the way their spicy tuna taste and its just hands down better. Im tired of all this poke bowl fancy smancy sauce blah blah blah poke stops....just stop. They let you even pick one topping for free and the one after is only 60 cents! Some places charged me $1.50 for green onions but Id be better of buying two bundles from the market for cheaper. Its located right next to the Korean market n puppy town. Ample parking available. Its just a small joint with a couple tables but they have one of the cleanest bathrooms lol. I think thats pretty important to show how tidy they are

I grew up in Hawaii, so good poke is not something I can pass up very often. I have been to Paina Cafe once before and I did enjoy it, but the poke wasn't as flavorful as I typically like it to be. If you live in Vegas and love poke, you're probably familiar with Poke Express. And if you are, then you will know what I mean by flavorful. This was my second time giving Paina a try. And while the fish was fresh, I still didn't feel like I enjoyed it as much as I normally would at Poke Express. The shoyu ahi was bland and the Hawaiian style was meh. I left with a mostly onion  flavor in my mouth, (which is fine, because I like onion) but onion generally shouldn't have been the main takeaway from that poke bowl. I give it 4 stars because the service was great and the place looked spectacular. The poke needs some kicking up!

By far the best poke place in town. I highly recommend the poke crunch bowl and the Kimura ahi katsu bowl. My kids are the ahi and didn't know it was fish. That's a for me!! The owner was so friendly and gave my boys complimentary spam masubi and let me try the kamaboko which was so onolicious!! I am Definitely coming back here!!

First time here I didn't realize it would be sushi bowls and dessert which I didn't mind.  I always like going to Island joints with options for the island flavor.  I ordered the bowl with Kalua Pork and Tuna which was excellent.  A little bowl of "surf n' turf".  

We tried the Spicy Ahi Inari and I enjoyed that.

Then there's dessert. We ordered a whole Ube Custard Pie and I loved it.  We've also tried the Pumpkin Custard and enjoyed that as well.

So with that being said, Happy Eatings until next time!
Food here is fire.. best in town that I've tried so far! I used to go here all the time in hawaii and glad I can enjoy it in Vegas!!

Paina Cafe is definitely a must try! Between the amazing customer service, the delicious fresh fish and the unique bowls I'm giving a 5 star rating! They answered all of my questions and the food came out quick! They even have a bitcoin buy and sell machine! Which is convenient and cool! If you are looking for a poke place I would definitely recommend.

Paina is my favorite place to get poke. They're a clear cut above the increasingly popular fast-casual poke spots that are popping up around town. The poke crunch bowl with shoyu ahi poke is my go-to dish. Full of great flavors with a slight sweetness to the sauce, the quality of the tuna is quite good. The Hawaiian poke bowl is another great option, combining your choice poke with kalua pork and Lomi salmon.

But, the main reason I love this place is the desserts and baked goods. If you want to piss someone off, order all the ube rolls in the case then watch as the people behind you start fuming. People flock here here for the ube -- rolls, tarts, the ube leche flan cake. And with good reason. They're all delicious. If you're not an ube fan, try the mango passion fruit cheesecake (my personal favorite), kulolo paina bar, chantilly cake or any number of other pastries that fill their case. The desserts here are so inexpensive and well crafted. Some days they run out of most of them by the late afternoon. So, get here early if you want your pick of the litter.

So I came here yesterday and went straight for their toilet 'cuz we just came from Lake Mead. You can really tell a lot about an establishment by their bathrooms. It was simple, clean, and minimally decorated. I even thought about putting similar tiles in my future bathroom walls. Anyways that's beside the point. My hubs ordered for me my usual as I had to head back out to the furry babies in the car but I love the Aloha spirit in here. Too many poke bowls around and I'm from LA...they literally are freakin' everywhere! I want the authentic ones with a Kane or Wahine serving me. I was hoping for just a poke bar like Foodland does it but I didn't see that. Maybe next time Paina!? I ordered the HI salmon bowl. The sweet onions mixed with sprouts on it made the dish compelling. They were generous with the masago which many places skimp on. That made me so happy. Masago and Ikura are like my favorite toppings! How did you know? I finished my entire bowl and even offered bits of my masago to my dog and cat who partook in my quest for poke.
GOOD!!! GOOD!!! And GOOD!!! Poke always tastes fresh...you can't get island pastries this good anywhere else in Vegas. You hungry? This is your go to...now hurry up before they close!!! LOL

One of the best poke spots that I've ever tried in Las Vegas! Their poke is nicely marinated and very reminiscent of poke in Hawaii. Unlike other poke spots in Las Vegas, this spot makes delicious traditional Hawaiian poke where the fish is marinated over time allowing it to have so much more flavor--I've noticed that many other poke spots just throw some (not so fresh) fish into a bowl of rice and add some sauces. 
I ordered the kewalo bowl and everything was absolutely amazing!
I would go here more frequently f it wasn't so far from where I live. Otherwise, this place is top notch and comparable to poke express which has my favorite poke.

I definitely want to come here for the ube cream puffs and the poke! However when I came here I found out they ran out of ube cream puffs :-( if you want the cream puffs come early cause I came around dinner time and they ran out. I decided to get the California poke bowl and an ube tart. I thought the California poke bowl was just okay, I didn't think it was that special. The toppings on it were fantastic though! The ube tarts were the standout of this place! It was so creamy and it tasted just like a Hong Kong egg tart but in ube form! I would definitely come back for ube tarts, a different poke bowl, and their ube cream puffs!

Terrible! Had to throw away almost all of the food! 
Spam musubi: cold and sauce was too sweet. Also left a bad after taste.
Fried saimin: noodles overcooked, bulgogi undercooked, and flavor was not good.
Poke bowl: ordered a large with salmon, spicy tuna, masago, and cilantro. As you can see I only got a sprig of cilantro. Asked for imitation crab and was told that I can't buy that as a side. Instead they wanted me to buy a california poke bowl and just leave off all of the toppings and just purchase the other 2 poke on the side. That makes no sense! Poke sucked. Salmon was overpowered by the ginger and onion flavor (yuck!), spicy sauce on tuna was mediocre, and rice was way over cooked!
This place was a waste of $30! Super disappointed and will never go back. Better off going to Jaburritos or any of the other places in town.

I was excited about this spot as I am a huge poke lover and enjoy the Hawaiian style flavor.  My better half ordered a poke crunch bowl and I ordered the Hawaiian poke bowl.  My wife's bowl had much better flavor and overall texture due to the spicy sauce that cloaked the quality of the fish.  My bowl tasted like it had lower quality fish.  I was somewhat disappointed.  The kalua pig was decent and the lomi salmon was good, but for 11 bucks, definitely mediocre at best.  I try to support kamaaina but I'd rather pay extra for quality fish than what was served.  Maybe I'll give this spot another try, bit I'm hoping they step their game up.
I love their poke bowls and the Bulgogi Ramen. And my favorite pastrie is the Ube Cream Puff and their Chocolate Chantily Cake.
It was okay but taste wise, they serve smaller bowls compared to others. They also charge $.60 for every add on. Will probably look elsewhere after this.

Tried this place with my family and a few friends..all week we've been excited..much to my surprise it was an absolute disappointment! First of all, you have kids that look like they're all under the age of 25 that works there..nice kids, however very unorganized. We had a pretty decent amount of bowls that we ordered as well as a couple of sides and a couple of desserts to try..as we get our orders slowly, they missed a few orders and also got them wrong. Waited for over 15 minutes for one of our last orders (after we got our food)..mind you, I had already gone up twice to ask for it..finally the third time I just asked for my money back! Now as I'm waiting for a response regarding my refund, I see one of the girls in the back, trying to open a sauce packet with her TEETH while looking at me! Really? Was it that hard to pick up a scissors and cut it open? I feel sorry for the person who got that order! Won't be going back anytime soon..all that money spent and very poor service!

The Haupia bar is so good. I also tried the salmon Poké which was delicious. I heard their mochi is made on Monday's and still have yet to try! Will definitely be back. I also saw they have sell cakes whether it's for birthday, wedding, or any other event and they're decorated beautifully

The whole "Hawaii to Vegas" thing couldn't ring more true than here at Paina Café. 

Located next to my favorite Asian market, Greenland, is a little slice of home (sweet home).

As soon as you walk in, you're greeted with a Hawaii radio station playing all the "local kine" jams. Then the workers are extremely happy and smiling, even as I walked in at their 11am opening. Aloha shoyu are the condiments on every table, fun/beachy art work are on the walls and even on the floor.

I ordered the Hawaiian Beef Bowl and my friend got the Poke Crunch Bowl.
I wanted taegu and takuan but, figured my beef bowl wouldn't be as tasty with it so, I ordered it for my friends' bowl =) lol
Also got the pickled garlic on the side. Which I have to tell you, I've never had outside of Hawaii. **in fact, the first time I've ever tried pickled garlic was this past October when I got to try Tanioka's pickled garlic. Paina Cafe's pickled garlic was sooooo gooooooood to eat with ever single bite of my beef bowl...ONO!!!!!!!
Beef bowl was super yummy and not overdosed with "teriyaki" sauce, like other places/bowls. Their teriyaki sauce wasn't as sweet as other teri sauces, too, which I love! The GARLIC CHIPS were the best addition to the bowl because, well, who doesn't love garlic -- like really!!??!!!!!
Their Poke Crunch bowl was very tasty with fairly big chunks of ahi and not too soy sauced and overly sweet. The one thing my friend wished he had in his bowl was the garlic chips lol
***note to self: ALWAYS ADD GARLIC CHIPS TO YOUR BOWL!!!!

So happy that another piece of home is right here on the 9th island =) It's (almost) as good as having Zippy's here! Almost.

My friends wanted to try this place.  We went there ordered the Inari bento for appetizer and it was good.  

We then ordered a cesar salad which was $7.95 which was just romaine and some cheese and one dressing and few pieces of sliced chicken.  Friend ordered a bowl that was ahi and I ordered that Katsu bowl total $31

Now what you get in the bowls  is a bowl that has about 3 scoops of rice in it and on the top 4 small pieces smaller smaller than a almondroca candy pieces of Panko fried tuna.  $9.95. That was discouraging.  Oh you got a side of potato spaghetti imitation crab salad.

Ate the ahi and some rice which was about 1/3 of the bowl threw rest away.  Both of us that got the bowls.  Thought it was going to be a lot with the big bowls but if you like rice this is the place to come to.  Spent total $50+ here with drinks.  Will go to island flavor next time for 3 people we will be ful

Ordered the chicken katsu plate & it was okay. My husband ordered the fried saimin w/ bulgogi and it was far from that. The saimin did not seem fried & the bulgogi seemed more like skirt steak, not thin cut meat. Pretty expensive for the portions that were given.

The bowls come pretty plain, with just rice and your meat selection. It would have been helpful if the staff recommended adding some toppings! We didn't know that the toppings were so important to making the bowl seem complete. 

Make sure you pick some additional toppings! Expect to pay $13 plus for the small bowl after adding 2 toppings.

Came here for the pancakes but its only served on Sundays.

We ordered the inari bento, fried saimin bulgogi. 

The inari is soo good. You'll just have to try that for yourself!

The fried saimin is yummy, comes with the potato salad and kimchi. A bit salty but good. 

Its a little pricey but it's still good.
Food is so yummy. You can defiantly taste the freshness in fish.  Definable going back.
Love this place! My go to whenever I need my Local food fix. Closes thing to home! Everything on the menu is ono!

We were a little disappointed that they have discontinued Brunch. Loco Moco and Benny were on the mind. You still can't beat them for poke bowl. The pastry is beyond onolicious and we will hold our breath until Brunch comes back. So glad they are in the neighborhood. It will be my go to meal when I don't feel like cooking. Gonna use them for catering too.
Poke bowls here are very good. Tried spicy tuna n Hawaiian style tako poke n was delicious. Place is very clean and staff was cool too. Highly recommended n I'll be coming back here for sure!

First things first.... staff is AMAZING. Everyone is super friendly and ofcourse carries the AL0HA spirit. No matter how good your food taste or how bad it taste you always want the customer service side to be 100% and this place definitely has it. Secondly the FOOD! 

Errrmygooosssgggg... I just moved to Las Vegas and when I walked through the doors it felt like I was right at home, eating the food made the experience all the more worth it.. it felt like a little piece of home far from home. Last but not least the desserts. Can I just say the chantilly tarts are almost already gone and we haven't even reached home yet which is 5 mins down the road and we haven't even tried the paina(ube) roll yet. All in all this place is awesome and the staff is awesomer (and yes I know awesomer isn't a real word! 

Thank you paina cafe for letting us feel like we're home when we walk through your doors! We will definitely be back probably more than once a week! 

P.s. My husband loves the fact that you guys sell samurai ice cream

So enough of this mainland fancy shmancy poke bowl craze with all your fancy mix ins and what not. Paina Cafe comes directly from Hawaii and plopped itself in Vegas' Spring Mountain/Koreatown area and I could not be happier.

Located in the same plaza at Greenland supermarket, Paina Cafe serves up poke bowls the way they are served at home: fish on top of rice. That's it plain and simple. The recent trend of poke bowls and sushi burritos that has been plaguing Vegas has changed the way meaning/expectation of what poke and poke bowls really are in Hawaii. 

I would highly recommend trying this place out. I usually get the half spicy ahi and half shoyu poke bowl at home but when I came to Paina Cafe here I opted for just spicy ahi because I love it that much! The fish was great quality and the fish to rice ratio is pretty spot on. Price-wise it may be a little more expensive than Hawaii but I'd gladly pay for quality when it comes to fish/poke.

New and Hot the Spicy Ahi Tuna !!! Amazing!! Sooo Fresh!!!! It a must have with rice add (garlic chips) I am coming here for my fresh fish fix again!!!  People check this place out it's new and just like how they do it on the Hawaiian Islands

This is the first time here, brought my son with me. Walking in, the place is really clean, decorated very tastefully, not over doing the Hawaii thing like some other places lol. Friendly staff, they say "Welcome! " when you come in, you don't see too much of that here... back home yah, but Vegas... no. Very simple menu, not a hundred different items, easy to understand what you're ordering. Food came in a timely manner. I ordered the Hawaiian bowl...kalua pig w/lomi salmon, poke and potato salad. My son got the chicken katsu plate. The katsu was ono, the kalua pig was lil bit dry but not bad, lomi salmon and poke was ono, but the potato salad...meh. Before we left I got 2 long johns and 1 chocolate haupia tart.  All in all, this is a good place,  I would definitely eat here again and would recommend to family n friends. Aloha! Ps. When we got home we ate the long johns, ho bruddah...da best!

Stopped in on Mother's Day and it was getting crazy! Luckily I got in early enough before the line went out the door, also they were mostly reservations needed to eat in as well. I went about 930am and they had beautiful Mother's Day rainbow cakes for $25 almost selling out, and even some of their breakfast menus were running out soon. Just get there as early as possible and expect to wait a bit if they're busy. But its definitely worth it! 

-poi mochi: best I've ever had here in Las Vegas $15/dozen but the balls are huge (that's what she said lol)
-mochi pancakes: got the kulolo & ube it was super ono!
-fried rice: typical but still good
-Rainbow cake: wish I took a pic, it was beautiful and I'm sure there's one somewhere on this yelp page. It was a gift but didn't get to taste it. They were also selling per slice. I think it's a bargain at $25 when it looks so professional and gourmet like I got if at a fancy bakery on the strip lol

Like i said get there early so you can try everything,
I think I like their breakfast more than their poke bowls and the desserts are just hard to find out here in LV so definitely get some if you can.

I grew up on Maui and tuna sashimi was my favorite food as a kid. I still love poke and pretty much any fresh seafood, so I was excited to try Paina Cafe after reading the reviews. I went with my wife during lunchtime. I ordered the Hawaiian Poke Bowl with shoyu poke, kalua pig and lomi salmon, my wife had the nanea salmon bowl. When we got our food I noticed that the poke  cut very small and warm to the touch. The flavor wasn't fresh, and I didn't taste and soy or onion just sesame oil soaked warm fish. The kalua pig was easily the worst I've had, very dry and stringy, also didn't taste fresh and had a pungent gamey flavor. The lomi lomi salmon was the worst part though, I even had to take my bowl up to the counter to let them know they didn't put any salmon in my bowl. They said 'that's it' and pointed and some chopped onion and tomato that I thought was salsa. Upon closer inspection found tiny little pieces of salmon that tasted very fishy. All the lomi lomi salmon I've had in my life had big pieces of fish not unlike the poke I'm used to getting in Hawaii. The bowls had a small amount of protein, were swimming in sauce, lots of rice, and no veggies.  My wife didn't enjoy her meal either, salmon was warm and had no ginger or soy flavor was just sweet and had tons of 'lemon citrus aioli' (mayo),so we just ate enough fish to not leave totally hungry, dumped our bowls, and left completely unsatisfied and disappointed in spending $25 on such an underwhelming lunch for two. No one came by to ask how our meal was and were defensive toward me asking about the missing salmon. No aloha vibe or authentic Hawaiian cuisine to be found here, and I was really surprised by our negative experience based on the other reviews.
Truly an awesome place with good food from good people. You can feel the aloha spirit when you walk in. The poke tasted fresh, just like real Hawaiian poke. We'll be back here soon!

I came here to check out the bakery goods.

Ahnette made me a spectacular birthday cake and I have ordered other goodies from her as well.

This place is tucked in a little nook in the shopping plaza.
All staff is super nice!

I came about 30 mins before closing, and there were very few pastries left. The ones that I did get were out of this world! You can tell that fresh ingredients were used! 

The parfaits were the perfect size and so flavorful!

The seafood dip was bomb.com and they even give you butter crackers to go with it.

Well def be back for the food!

First Let me say that I'm a Yelp fan and have been trying to come to this place for a while . Finally the day came and decided to go and check it out . Exactly what I expected and Wow... . 

This food is something else and its flavors are incredible. The service is also off the hook with the nicest staff. I will certainly comeback and recommend this wonderful place to everyone who either live or come to Las Vegas to visit .
Both portions size and the price are nothing to complain about , it's absolutely wonderful .
Thanks " Paina Cafe " and its team , you guys have  exceeded my expectations.

Angel Vidal

I really can't deny it.  Paina Café has some pretty good poke at really good prices.  $3.75 for 4 oz., $7.50 for 8 oz., and $15 for 12 oz.  I've tried their Spicy Ahi, Shoyu, Hawaiian Style Tako, and Salmon. My favorite of the 4 is their Shoyu.  It's so good and wish that I got more than just 4 oz.  The salmon did nothing for me.  I'll just skip it next time. 

Paina specializes in poke bowls priced at $9.45 for a regular or a $10.45 for a large.  You definitely get your money's worth with a large at just a $1 more.  Their Poke Crunch Bowl and Ahi Katsu look interesting. I'm just going to have to try one of those on my next visit.  Paina Café is not just limited to poke or poke bowls. They also have meat bowls, noodles, fried Ahi Katsu, Spam Masubi, and desserts by Ono Sweetz.  No doubt, I will be making a trip back here most likely sooner than later.
Best poke bowls in Las Vegas by far! Poke crunch bowl is amazing! Even better than back home. The tofu poke is super good too.

My husband and I usually go to Pa'ina once a week! Sometimes we'll go more if our diets allow us to. Their poke is hands down the best in Las Vegas and I have tried most. It tastes JUST like home. I actually went home recently and remember thinking the poke here was better than some of the ones back at home! Their fried noodles are amazing and don't get me started on their pastries. The pastries may me a little pricey but they are worth every penny. Last but not least, the staff is truly amazing! Filled with aloha! I will always support Pa'ina Cafe!

I absolutely loved parts of my meal today, but not all of it, so I must break the seemingly endless tide of complete praise.

I finally followed the hype train to Paina Cafe today. Anyone who follows food has witnessed the increasingly popular fad of "poke bowls," where you can create your own bowl of sauced raw fish with various toppings, but this is the first one I've heard of that actually started in Hawaii, home of traditional poke. This location is in a strip mall next to Greenland Supermarket facing Spring Mountain Rd, and the parking lot was quite packed in the late afternoon.

I didn't feel up to building my own bowl (or Googling some of the names of the toppings), so after consulting a few reviews while in line, I ended up ordering the Large Poke Crunch bowl ($11.25) with my choice of white rice (instead of brown) and toppings including teri glaze, shredded nori, and crispy tempura flakes. The cashier told me that I could order two proteins with this particular bowl, so I did: Hawaiian style ahi poke, and shoyu ginger salmon poke.
