The shoyu ginger salmon was at first just a casual add-on for variety's sake, but it become the star of my bowl very quickly. Having had quite a bit of salmon belly lately, I was shocked to find that this tasted just like those recent experiences, rather than standard salmon. It was about as decadent as you can get in anything savory that's not pure globs of fat.

I was rather disappointed with the rest of the bowl. The warm, non-sushi rice did nothing for me, and neither did the Hawaiian style ahi, which was more reportedly sesame oil-focused than the shoyu ahi poke that I was also considering, but didn't really carry that flavor strongly, or any other traditional ingredient for that matter. The ahi itself wasn't that impressive either, with some pieces appearing haphazardly chopped instead of in cube form. Adding some of the Aloha shoyu available table-side did help, but I still couldn't help but see and taste a stark contrast between this so-called ahi poke and the delicious, flavorful by-the-pound poke from a local business that predates the poke bowl phenomenon.

I almost wanted to give the full 5 stars anyway because of the salmon and because of dessert. As confirmed by the cashier, the huge variety of pastries on display are made by a local business called Ono Sweetz 702, and I've tried and enjoyed several of their treats before at a Henderson coffee shop.

I wanted to try pretty much everything, but I settled on just the Mango Carrot Cheesecake ($3.75). It was my first time trying this pastry from Ono Sweetz, and it was spectacular. A shortbread cookie foundation is topped with a carrot cake base and followed by a large layer of mango cheesecake, and the crown is an ube whipped cream garnished with gold flakes and a long, thin piece of chocolate. The ring-shaped piece of dark chocolate was also awesome. This was flavorful, balanced, and pretty enough to be in any high-end pastry shop. Don't tell them about this review or else they'll start getting ideas...

Paina Cafe is a great poke bowl shop with great desserts, but judging from my meal today, it's not the be all and end all of all things poke. Still, I'd come back any time for the salmon and the pastries, and I'd also love to try the shoyu ahi, tako, or their cooked offerings such as kalua pig, beef, and ahi katsu.

We ordered the Poke Crunch bowl with spicy tuna and shoyu tuna. It was fresh and the white rice was good. We also ordered a Taro drink, a ube tart, and Ube puff. I enjoyed the ube desserts. They were the best ube. The Taro drink was surprisingly good. I thought it would taste like powdered Taro mixed with water, but it didn't.

I don't like poke but I came to a place that specializes in poke for lunch yesterday. You may be wondering why. Well, I came with a couple of co-workers and they like poke. Besides, Pa'ina has more than just poke. 

I ordered fried saimin with bulgogi beef. It also came with a side of rice and a side of kimchi. I enjoyed it all. Fried noodles are always good. The beef was ultra tender. The rice was simply white rice but mixed with the kimchi was very good. Kimchi has a strong enough flavor that it makes an impact on even the plain white rice. It all made for a delicious lunch. 

I got a little more bold and adventerous when I tried a bite of the tako poke my co-worker ordered. It was my first taste of octopus. Sure, I've had similar creatures like squid (fried calimari) and cuddle fish (freeze dried and dressed with chili sauce). But this was a full on tentacle with suction cups. Thats has always scared me a bit. But I tried it. It was chewy and didn't really taste like much. It was not as bad as I expected but I would not order for myself in the future. Just not my thing.

I wish I had ordered a dessert yesterday to round out my meal. The custard pastries looked so good. I guess I just have to go back again. There are some other non-poke plates aside from the saimin I got. They have options at Pa'ina.

It's like a taste of home. This is the real stuff. There have been a lot of poke shops that have opened up, but they're all "mainland-style" poke with no ties to Hawai'i. I've come to learn that if they offer poke in a burrito, stay away. No burrito-style poke on this menu. So, we are good. 

It was 'ono. Just like the P?'ina Cafe back at Ward. I ordered the Hawaiian bowl with spicy ahi. Only bad part was when the bowl was empty! 

The feel good island music makes the atmosphere that much better. Will definitely be coming back! 

Tip: grab spam musubi for snack later.

I tried salmon poke bowl, fish was fresh and very tasty.
The lady at the cashier is nice.

FINALLY got to make it out to my local Paina Cafe to actually order a poke bowl after being open here in Vegas for some time. I used to eat at the original spot back home in Hawaii and needless to say, it definitely did not disappoint. I ordered the Paina bowl which is one of their original bowls. It consists of rice (I got white), topped with spicy tuna, nori flakes and their own teri glaze sauce. To my surprise the cashier told me that I was allowed one other protein so I added the Hawaiian Style Ahi poke. Let's just say, I devoured it! The poke was so fresh and the sweetness of the teri glaze was a great addition to the meal. I'm very simple when it comes to poke bowls/burritos and I would much rather not have all the additional toppings to it was perfect. Another plus is all the delicious desserts! They have several different flavored tarts - we got the north shore and ube tart. The north shore tart was a layer of haupia under a layer of chocolate...soooo damn ono! The ube tart was also good however, you don't get the flavor of ube as much but it was still good. Aside from what we ordered, they have many more local Hawaii desserts. 

I read a review regarding the service and that person wasn't too pleased with it. With that said, my boyfriend and I did not get any snarky attitude. Instead, we were greeted by the cashier who was friendly, informative and more than happy to serve us.

I have heard good things about this place so i tried it and it is so good! Its the best hawaiian food i found out here since i got back from hawaii. The staff is very welcoming and the place is clean.

I'm a believer. I love Hawaii and when this place popped up I was eager for it to take me back. Take me back it did. The poke was delish. I've tried the spicy ahi, shoyu ahi and shoyu salmon. I didn't like the salmon as much but that's because I don't favor ginger.  I know I should being Asian and all but ginger and cilantro is a yuck in my book. 

The sweets...I have to say that I've enjoyed the puffs and the tarts the most. I've tried the snow puffies and aloha Haupai bar and that was way too sweet for my taste. However, I definitely would go back to get the puffs or even order an chantilly cake. My husband said that people just go there to order sweets too so heads up if you want some they sell out quick. I did send my husband right when they opened and by the time he ordered they were bringing out new items...so maybe wait 30 minutes before you head down there. 

Overall I think it's oh so ono!

Stopped in during a trip to Vegas. I'm from Hawaii but go to school in Oregon and this was exactly what I needed and more! Their menu is a little more limited than the ones in Hawaii (I think, not positive) but they have lots of different add ons like pickled garlic! Yum! Their tarts are to diiiieeeee fooorrrrrr!!!! Especially the ube and North Shore ones. Even the kamaboko dip took my tastebuds back home:) Wish I could go back!

Stopped by after church. My daughter heard of this spot. Ordered? the beef bowl and vege. Food came out warm not hot. Vege was tasty and the sauces. For a small beef bowl was almost 10$bucks.. Go to Aloha Specialty on the 2nd floor of California hotel and you pay 3$bucks and it's triple the size. And flavourful. Their dessert was very good but ten dollars for 6 tarts waaay to much. Played alot of my favorite Hawaiian jamz though.. no ice in ice dispenser when asked for ice got a small scoop... Hot day, just wanted something cool to drink....I'll pass for the next round here

The place just opened, but so far so good. 
Paina cafe has your traditional Hawaiian style poke. 
I wasn't feeling poke today so I got the Hawaiian beef bowl and a spam furakake musubi  and a lilikoi passion fruit drink. The staff was very friendly and greeted me once I stepped in, they were patient as I read menu. I will defiantly be coming back since its right down the corner from work.

This a 5 Star UBE PUFF review. Puff ain't no joke. This all UBE (pronounced OOO beh) gift wrapped lightly in thin pastry and topped with UBE!  If you like UBE, you be in heaven!  And they have Poke too.

Monkey do:

NANEA SALMON POKE BOWL- no picking what toppings you want. This what you get. And you know what?  They're right!  This is what Monkey want!  How you know?  Delicioso!  Monkey eat too much rice though. Still, very good poke bowl. 

BANANA CREAM TART-  what a great little PIE!

UBE PUFF- Monkey say, "OOOOOOOHHHBAAAYYY!"  This a racquetball-sized gob of UBE!   I don't care if my mouth is purple. It's happy. 

Monkey cannot wait to return for weekend brunch items and more UUUUUUBEEEE!!!

I can't decide between 3 and 4 stars. I'd say Paina is 3.5 for me. I may have to try more food items to see if I like it more... I tried the poke bowl and really wasn't impressed. The fish was fresh but I could of used a larger variety of toppings. The rice to fish ratio was not balanced. My bowl was mostly rice. 
What I have really enjoyed here is the desserts! Originally from Ono Sweets, they are definitely a reason to return. I tried the North Shore Tarts, Ube Puff, and Coconut Cake. All sooo good! My favorite was the Ube Puff - moan worthy!
I will return to try other things off the menu to see if I like it more. I look forward to trying the inari. Looks really good!

Checked this place out. I must say, coming from Hawaii this poke place is legit. Not like the other wanna be poke places that tries to add on weird toppings on their bowl. What you get here is what you would get as if you were in Hawaii and that's what I love about this place.

Was recommended to try this place out instead of the other rapidly growing "Poke Bowl" joints sprouting out all over the valley all of a sudden? 
Had the Ahi Katsu Bowl but to me was over cooked and just tasted like deep fried fish popped on rice and drizzled with sauce. 
Also had the "Fried Saimin"? You've got to be kidding me charging $12 for that? Nothing to brag about, but I got that because the regular Saimin was not in "season" anymore?
Best part about the whole meal was the Haupia bar, as they already sold out of their Chantilly cake not even 2 hours after they've open on a Saturday when we were there? If they claim they make their own desserts, they should be happy that they sell out, but not with 7 more hours of operation to sell it. 
Workers seem like they are just there, and not very courteous at the same time, maybe that's just how the place is managed. I dunno, but just way too many "poke" places in general in town now and this place should stand out being an extension from the original Oahu location, just ordered the wrong items or had a cook that was just there...

Had the crunchy bowl with ahi, garlic chips, brown rice and Hawaiian seaweed plus Tako poke. Always add garlic chips. Crunchy bowl was tasty, had pretty good portions of protein. I would come back again.
The Spicy Tuna has to be one of the best outside Hawaii and I enjoyed the atmosphere inside.  I went to Sweet Poke and was highly disappointed.  Found a new place for my poke fix.
Called in 2 days earlier to make reservations and was told there was an opening at 1230pm. Came in and turns out they don't do reservations. Unorganized Cafe with their service.

This is one happnin' hoppin' Hawaiian hale! I loved the decor of slippers at the door!

The eclairs are definitely one of kind, and this Hawaiian style is pretty difficult to find on the mainland. 

Bowls ordered were the salmon Paina and the Hawaiian. The salmon was a great taste and color and a good portion. With the Hawaiian, the Lomi salmon was on point, but the Kalua pig was subpar, lacking the smokey flavor and juiciness, I'm used to having. The pulehu Tako was good, although, I prefer the plain, and much thinner cuts. It's so chewy to begin with. 

The spicy tuna poke in inari was pretty awesome and unique, a must try.

I have yet to try any taro or ube. I guess they sell out fairly early in the day.

The food is okay. I enjoy the poke, musubi, and fried saimin; however, when I went for brunch, the food was under cooked. The loco moco patty was still raw. The mochi pancakes were okay. The price is really expensive but the desserts is what keeps me coming back. Onosweetz pastries are to die for. Everything from their mochi to their cakes. My favorites are mochi (the best especially the mango and guava), puffs, rolls, and the haupia bar! Very friendly staff. Food is average but desserts are yummy! I am interested to try more of their creations.

Tried their Nanea Salmon Poke Bowl and I must say it was beautifully crafted and delicious. But the absolute best part about this place is their dessert! I got the Aloha Pack tarts in the fridge so I can try every flavor.

Fair prices, fresh fish, nice portions, and those tarts!! HAVE TO GET.

Walked in after work (I just found out it's on the way home from me!) - atmosphere is modern, open, and clean with an island feel. The staff greeted me right away, I ordered to go and was offered a water cup while I wait. Don't mind if I do!

Now the food - Got 4oz of Tuna and 8oz of Salmon as well as a half dozen of assorted tarts.

The fish is extremely fresh and they pack it full. Poke is always a balance of sauce and fish. Sometimes it's too strong and you lose the fish flavor. Sometimes it's like "did you even add sauce?" - but Paina does it right! The fish flavor comes through but is not drowning. The green and white onion are a nice crunch and punch of onion flavor. 

The tarts - must get! There were maybe 6 or so flavors when I was there, but got 3 of them.  Paradise, Chantilly, and Ube (thanks Yelpers!). Paradise was a nice mix of tropical fruits (that I forgot, sorry!); Chantilly, sweet whipped cream topping with chocolate on the inside, and of course the Ube. All of them were damn good. But Ube had to take the tart! Paradise came in second and I am not sure if I would get Chantilly again, but I would recommend the others! All of the fillings are velvety and smooth and the tart "shell" is buttery and flavorful. One thing to note is that these tarts are two-biters and do not crumble after you bite into it.

Since coming here, I have dropped all other poke places from my mind. I will also be looking into getting one of their specialty cakes for a party coming up. Will update in the future about those!
By far the best poke in Vegas. Fresh tuna. Had the shoyu and spicy tuna crunch bowl.  Most importantly, restaurants is very clean. Recommend eating here.

We came just for the desserts that heard so highly about... The drive way far from wea we at, but in all it's worth the drive.. the long john I was kina unsure but yes it's as close to back home kine..ONO!! My husband n kids ate the haupia cake and puffs had no chance  everybody so friendly and gud aloha feeling.. thank u for bringing home to us all..

Omgggggg thank god theres a place in vegas with REAL HAWAIIAN POKE!! If you're eager to try poke like how its made in Hawaii than you should come here! I had the Hawaiian poke bowl that came with kalua pig, lomi salmon (salmon, tomato, white onions), your choice of rice & poke. I chose brown rice with spicy ahi. The look & most importantly flavor of the food was on point! Thank you paina cafe for satisfying my poke cravings. I will definitely be back again.

I've been wanting to try paina cafe for quite some time but it's long ways away from my house so yeah. Anyway, finally made the trip this past weekend & im angry at myself that I didn't come sooner lol. It's located in koreatown, somewhere next to subway. 

I ordered the regular poke crunch bowl with spicy ahi & add garlic chips. My bf had something else that I don't remember lol. I read reviews & tips & people kept raving about the kamboko(sp?) dip so I decided to try that. I wasn't crazy about the dip. Although it did combine very well with the ritz crackers. The regular bowl was fairly small. I had my first bite & immediately regretted not getting the large... but thennn, i had trouble finishing my bowl cos I was getting so full. Lol. The fish they have is so so good & amazingly fresh. I honestly believe that they have the best poke in the valley. I thought it was poke express but this place blows that one out of the water. 

If you haven't tried this place, I suggest you make the trip today. It's that good.

This place is hands down my favorite place to go for Poke. The fish is fresh and flavorful and the rice is cooked to perfection. My brother and I liked this place so much we had come back the next day for round two. Make sure to leave room for dessert!  I only got a couple but my favorite was the guava tart. I'm definitely going to have to try the other ones next time.

This place is such a gem  it has amazing amazing food and delicious desserts. I love how cute the decor is, how great the vibe is and how wonderful all the people are. Every business and restaurant should take note- this is how you give customer service! But not just that, the poke bowls and the UBE TARTS I need more of everything. Can't wait to go back!

Seriously this is just plain make you cry good hand made old school local food. 

Today I picked up a poke platter for the office. My staff went crazy. Every time I go back they have got more and more good local stuff hand made Mochi pasteries omg broke da mouth.

Great Poke. You can choose your own toppings.  My favorite is the spicy tuna with masago and onion as toppings.  The large portion is perfect.  

Glad the Hawaiian local option is here in Vegas.  Cool place & staff.

The reason I went here is the poke bowl. It was very good. I had the Crunchy bowl with spicy Tuna. BUT i also ordered UBE tart and UBE puff. It doesn not taste like UBE. Its just some sugary dessert with purple food coloring. I still gave 4 stars because the Poke Bowl was really good...

This is one of my favorite places to grab dinner on my way home from work. The staff is super friendly and the food is delicious. Love that they added desserts and keep the menu selection fresh with new options. I wasn't really a fan of poké bowls before I found Paina. I would love for them to open another location close to downtown.

The sign caught my eye "Hawaiian Poke Bowl."  I'm glad it did.  $10.. top quality.. nice packed bowl with ALOT of poke!!  Really really clean and wonderful counter service.  Plaza Spring mnt/Rainbow!     and they have a loyalty program.  I'll be back soon!  Thanks!
Ono grindz!!!! Tako bowl was amazing. We will be back and sve some room for some ono sweets 702!!
Finally have a poke bowl place on this side of town I can trust!! Very good food and the spam musubi was good as well!

amazingly fresh and delicious. The fish, veggies and rice and seasonings are wonderful

I live far from this restaurant and make the trek about once a week as it has become addicting.

Not being from Hawaii I don't know good poke from bad, but from the several poke places I've tried in Vegas this is my favorite.  I usually get the Hawaiian bowl and it's delicious.  Service is fine.  My only complaint is that this place is known for its deserts and on my most recent visit they has almost no deserts available.  So a minor let down.  But when I have a hankering for poke and other Hawaiian foods this will continue to be my go-to place.

First time here. Great Service! I didn't get her name but she was very patient with us. Food was good I got the Poke Crunch Bowl which was one of their popular bowls. Quality of the food was Good but the Dessert though  BOMBDOTCOM. Will definitely come back to try other stuff.
Super delicious and prices were decent! I definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone! Their ahi is amazing and the staff there is so kind! Love this place.
Best poke bowl in town, hands down. Don't even waste your time on other poke bowl places. This place is our new go-to poke spot.

I'm glad they didn't replicate their Honolulu location's menu.  Much  more impressed here by the sweets.  Third party reports of the hot food (real meals) suggest they have tasty food instead of the health-conscious (not that  great tasting) fare served in Honolulu.   Wish I could comment on more than the sweets but honestly,  the sweets are worth a trip here on their own.  Particularly good is the  ube (sweet potato) mochi.  YUM!
Went to this Poke place last night and I can honestly say that I would definitely come back. The service was great! Friendly staff. Food was delish!
Finally delicious poke in las vegas and its near my place! Awesome and friendly service! Happy they expanded here in vegas.

Now this is what I call a poke bowl! Don't be fooled by other places opening up around town. This is the real deal! P?'ina is straight outta the 808 and we are blessed to have the 4th location here on the 9th island. 

Poke crunch bowl: Yum! Had this with spicy tuna and shoyu ahi and it was perfect. I love the available toppings like kim chee!

Nanea salmon: Fresh with a great citrus taste! 

Can't do raw fish? No problem! They have tofu poke, teriyaki beef, kalua pig, and imitation crab. 

Poke can also be purchased by weight (1/4,1/2, and 1 lb, but listed as ounces on menu)

Aloha spirit is strong here and workers are friendly and the owner checks in on customers. 

The interior is very clean and done nicely. I like the island beach vibe with the colors and art work. 

I'll be back to try everything on the menu.

*****Yelp 100 2016 Challenge*****
61/100

ALOHAAAAAAA from the 9th island! We are very fortunate to have an abundance of local kine grindz here. Options from local plates, desserts, coffee places and most recently poke places have been sprouting left and right. Some are definitely better than others.

A recent discovery is Paina and quickly becoming a favorite. Not only is the food good but the Aloha spirit is strong here, service is always on point and the 3 times I've been here not once did we leave disappointed.

Concept is pretty simple and fail proof. Order your base, either white or brown rice then poke of your choice: Spicy tuna, Shoyu Ahi, Hawaiian style Ahi, Wasabi Masago Ahi, Shoyu Ginger Salmon, Sweet Chili Tofu and Tako poke when available. After that you choose from the variety of toppings they offer like Masago, Furikake, Takuan, Crispy garlic chips to name a few. Then voila! a bowl of deliciousness before your eyes, meant to be savored and not devoured lol. If you're like me and too many choices confuse you, they offer Paina signature bowls. Of those the Nanea Salmon poke bowl is the one that calls to me: Brown rice with Ginger Salmon Poke drizzled with lemon citrus aioli with red onions, radish sprouts, masago and shredded Nori. Yaaasssssss!

If raw fish is not for you, their menu boasts of options like Kalua Pig, Beef bowl and Ahi Katsu. I have tried the latter and I loved it! Perfectly crisp on the outside but still moist. Also a must try, the hubby's fave! Inari with rice topped with Spicy tuna, it's genius! A meal in itself but perfect to be shared as an appetizer. Salad is offered for those that are conscious of their carb intake, and poke by the ounce is sold as well.

In one of the visits we spoke with the owner and he excitedly shared with us that they have a lot of stuff in the works right now. Promos, new offerings, menu line up and such. So excited for what's to come! Recently, I heard that they've partnered up with Ono Sweetz bringing in more sweetness in the joint. Can't wait to go back!

I've been wanting to try these Instagram famous desserts for so long, and finally got a chance to try it out! This experience turned out to be just great as it looks like!! 

1. Ube cake roll: filled with ube cream and custard. Little fancy gold paper on top, the cake part was super moist and not over sweet! Also the gold paper on top made it look so fancy~

2. Mango cheesecake: I loved each bite of it ! The texture of this cake was on another level. I could taste the light cream, chunks of mango fruit and, creamy cheesecake part, at the end the the shortbread! The chef mixed toasted pecan with the shortbread, so yummy

3. Cream puffs: so so so good!! I was wondering what's on top of the puff before I bite into it. Also I was worried abt it being too creamy and sweet! But no! When I bite in! Oh god !!!! It's was just so balanced and perfect texture !!! 

I just can't wait to comeback and try more items!!

"Where's your rice, teri glaze, furikake, tegu, seaweed salad and avocado, kalua pig, salmon / tomato / onion thingy?" questions my dining companions, all from the Continent watching as I set down four plastic containers of poke and a pair of chopsticks.

"Help yourselves, it's better than those silly bowls you ordered".  Famous last words as they devoured my offerings (and lunch) while discovering don't mess with a good thing.

It's about time.  A Hawaii poke restaurant in Vegas.

Sure, it doesn't have the best rating in Hawaii (we got high standards since lots of places make killer poke from fish and limu pulled from the ocean just hours before), but it definitely blows away the other pretenders hawking "Hawaiian poke".    Wisely, they also serve enough "Cali" style poke and poke bowls to keep everyone happy.

Straight to it, the ahi poke, previously frozen fish, properly thawed and well handled (not gassed nor color added) cut into mid sized cubes.  Firm texture and good flavor as expected.  The shoyu ahi with its crisp, sweet white onion, finely chopped scallion, sesame oil and most importantly Aloha shoyu and wasabi masago, just as its name implies.  Zero complaints. If they have it, grab some tako poke.  No translucency (sign of repeated freezing and thawing), tender and tasty.  For a special treat, the pulehu tako.  Sure it looks bad but it taste oh so good!

Spicy ahi, salmon, and tofu poke also offered (not sampled).

All poke sold by the pound or if you absolutely must, the dreaded poke bowl.  Signature bowls adapted for Mainland taste.  Do it yourself with minimal but chosen to match toppings also offered.

Friendly off Strip counter service.  Pricing slightly higher than others in the Valley.

Winnah!
Fish katsu ... so yummy!  Have to save room for dessert ! I took home an assortment of tarts , they were delicious!!!

Stopped in at the Paina Cafe, Las Vegas NV location for some lunch on the way back to San Diego last Sunday afternoon and i'm gla we did.   Kip and his crew are doing awesome stuff in the quite little area off Spring Mountain road.   My wife and I both had the famous Kimura Ahi Katsu.  Wow, instense flavors, good crunch and just a right amount of potato salad on the side and I have to say its one of the best potato salads i've had.   My son had a spicy ahi bowl with a few sides and my other son had the Kalua pork bowl,  both loaded with poke and kalua pork.   I samped both and could have easily had either one of them for lunch.   Don't forget Annette and her scrumptious desserts.   The coco puffs.....insane! The little chantilly and ube tarts is where its at!   Dad had a Long John, he left nothing but powered sugar dust on the floor!  Sorry about the mess!  We had to get a few more for the long ride back home!    Mahalo Kip and your crew

By far the best poke bowl I've had!
Fresh and tasty. Great service and kind employees.

I only wanted poke. No fillers. Dont need any of the extras...Asked for 1 lb of spicy ahimsa  (16 oz.) And was given 12.5 oz. But I was charged full price. The half 1/2lb of sweet and masago salmon was on Point but the thought of ever going back is a big no. When give you poke A la Carte they don't weigh it front of you nor do they label the weight so you know what you're getting.  Would be nice if you knew what you were paying for. Had I not weighed it when I got home..I never would have known I was getting shafted. Imagine how many other people this happens to. It all adds up. Tip: invest in a scale so folks can actually see and know what they're playing for like other poke shops. Taste= 2 stars.

Giving only 4 stars cause they too 'far' from home (Silverado Ranch). ;) Thank goodness though you guys far cause then I'd come everyday and be broke by next paycheck. Lol! Keep up the awesome food quality!
Yummy food always made fresh :) my fave is there fried ahi bowl and poke bowls. There dessert is so good too espc the Ube cream puff and the different flavored tarts they have.

Paina Cafe serves poke, kahlua pork, and katsu bowls. The fish is fresh and the combinations are just delicious. You can get white rice or brown rice. They also have salads. Your protein choices for poke bowls include ahi, salmon, tuna, tofu, and tako (octopus). Pretty generous servings here.

After a savory meal, indulge in some fabulous sweet treats. They have desserts from Ono Sweets. Cakes, cream puffs, rolls, tarts, etc. They're not overly sweet. I like the flavors: ube, passion fruit, guava, chantilly, matcha, haupia, and chocolate. The desserts are very colorful and vibrant. You can special order cakes. They tend to sell out at different times so, come early.

It is located in Koreatown. The place is clean. Service is friendly. Great food especially dessert!

Paina Cafe is located in the Greenland shopping center.  The service is friendly and the place is clean.   I wanted the breakfast sooo much but when we entered at 11am I only saw the poke bowl menu listed.   

Ordered:
Hawaiian poke bowl with Lomi salmon and kalua pig.  
Everything was really fresh and delicious.  

Salmon poke bowl
Fresh salmon.  Nice and fluffy brown rice 

Cocoa puff and ube puff.   How can you go wrong??  

Everything was ono except I really wanted the breakfast.  I asked when they stopped serving and they said that it's served ALL DAY!   I guess bc it was almost lunch they changed the menu on the screens.  But being a 1st timer I didn't know breakfast was all day.  Wish they had a sign that said that.  

Anyways.  Everything was good.  Have to support the 9th Island locals.   Will be back to try breakfast next time

Just like being back home! From the Aloha spirit of the friendly and helpful staff to the delicious Poke bowl. 702 now has a legit 808 poke place! The Poke craze is creating a stir here on the mainland. When locals from Hawaii knows what is really good in terms of Poke. Once you enter this modern and island feel ambiance you'll notice the wooden tables and metal chairs. Along with artwork that pays homage to the Islands of Hawaii. 

They have a set menu or if your feeling adventurous try BYO-Build Your Own Poke Bowl. The possibilities is endless and I highly recommend trying the Shoyu Ahi Poke. I added Garlic Chips, Furikake, Masago & Seaweed Salad. Everything was delicious and fresh! Definitely will be back for more!

Mahalo to the staff @ Paina Cafe!
Thanks and shoutout to Laurie V, Melissa V, Travis K, Kari U for your awesome recommendations!

I like this place only because I'm from Hawaii and because there aren't much restaurants or eateries that have poke in a bowl, with rice. Prices are understandable being that poke is expensive. However, paying $8+ for a half pound is kinda steep. 

I have been to the original place back home and this place does not disappoint. I just wish the location was much more closer to the university so I could come here often. Other than that, I had the Paina Bowl, and did half spicy ahi poke and half shoyu ahi poke. A friend had the California Bowl and he liked it. I have yet to try more of the menu items and will be returning soon.

Best Hawaiian Poke Bowl place in the area!

I ordered the Large Paina Bowl with white rice. The spicy tuna tasted fresh and I love the sauce it came with (next time, I'll say a little lighter on the soy sauce though). The portions were generous for $11.10 and they offered me a cup of water while I waited for my order.

Overall, I had a great Poke Bowl experience! I would definitely recommend this place.

Great poke bowl place!  Rice portion too much than the amount of poke served lol! Rated it 4 star because of their awesome desserts. Long john is fluffy soft with a creamy goodness! Chantilly cake slightly different from Hawaii's original version. Maybe a bit more caramel, butter or condense milk taste into it. The shaka (rainbow) cake was perfect with all three layered flavors. Cream puffs good but too thick of a cream frosting on top. Great place for hawaiian local sweet tooths!

I've just recently tried their food -- and more desserts! 

I ordered the Hawaiian Poke Bowl with Hawaiian Style poke. I do like how it comes with Kalua pig and Lomi Salmon! Although the Kalua Pig was a bit dry, I loved the flavor it added to my poke bowl. Idk if my ratios are just off, but I was left with way more rice than I expected. I don't think I'll drive all the way over here for a poke bowl when there are closer poke places near me. But I'd definitely drive over here for the ube tarts. 

I tried the ube cream puffs and the chantilly cream puffs, both very delicious, but maybe a bit expensive... $1.75 for one, if I remember correctly. 

If I'm in the area, I'd come back to try something else, but again, wouldn't drive aaaall the way over there.
Here's to being a newbie in Vegas and to my first review....Yuuuuuuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm ok, done lol

My new favorite poké spot! Also super close to my work so that's a plus. Their poké bowls are a bit different from other poké places around the valley since they use "Hawaiian" style poké in their bowls, and not just raw fish mixed in with whatever sauce you pick. Like, I could get a bowl with shoyu ahi poké, which is my favorite.
I also tried their ube custards, and they are DELICIOUS! For Thanksgiving, I ordered the big ube custard, which turned out to be more like an egg pie with ube on the top layer. I was expecting more ube, but it was yummy regardless. My whole family and friends loved it also, and would like me to bring them more sometime!
The decor is simple and cute. I really like the mat and the slippers painted on the floor when you walk in. It gives off home-y aloha vibes.

Kip is the man along with his wonderful team! Great customer service comes a long way! I haven't had a chance to write a review since I last visited this establishment. My whole family and I traveled to LV to celebrate my marriage on New Years Eve. Last minute we decided to have an after party after the reception so while having lunch the day prior at the cafe we expressed that we knew it was short of a notice to order pupus (appetizers) for the next day. Knowing new years eve being the next day we would of not have thought our needs would have been met. We ordered several platters including the spicy tuna inari which was sooo ono and assorted poke. I would like to express how much we appreciate both  quality of food and service. This is a must place to "GRIND" (EAT)! we will definitely eat here again,  See you soon! 

AZ OHANA

Their food was bland, and not even Hawaiian. I ordered the Hawaiian poke bowl and I have so much to say about it hat I disliked. Their kalua pork was extremely dry with no taste, and their Hawaiian ahi poke was bland and tasted like plain tuna with no flavoring. I added a lot of flavors at home so I just ignored the fact of my disappointment, but an hour later after a short nap, I woke up to the worst stomach ache imaginable even though this was the only thing I've eaten today. If you want quality Hawaiian food, I'd suggest you spend your precious money elsewhere. Cheaper places such as L&L's cook and offer tastier and juicier kalua pork, ahi poke, and ect

A lot poke bowl shops are popping out around the town and since this is close me I figured I will give it a try.  The restaurant is clean and nice, and when I got there around 6, it was not very busy.  Unfortunately, they ran out salmon at the time, which I find a bit disappointing... so I ordered the Hawaiian pole bowl with octopus, which is pretty good. But I had to say their menu is a little confusing to me, it's not very clear which type of fish they offer, and they tell you that you can pick the premade poke bowl with the fish of your choice,but then what are the fish... Also, of course you can make your own bowl combinations.  Maybe I'm just not familiar with the menu.

Overdue review so this'll be quick.

Bae and I came here on the way home and we got two poke bowls. The one with deep fried ahi was WONDERFUL but so filling. You don't tend to see deep fried ahi anywhere in a poke place so that was nice.

It's pretty new so there was adequate seats, and the parking is spacious. 

I was really satisfied with my bowl, 10/10 would come again.

Love the many topping combinations.  Very yummy.  I personally love larger chunks of fish to the point where there is almost too much fish, but instead of being too much you feel like you're getting a lot for your money.  Regardless, i still like this place and will come back again to try out the other combinations.

I tried the Hawaiian ahi poke and it was delicious! They put the perfect amount of the poke over the rice too. The service was excellent! I think the gentleman who took my order noticed that I was in a hurry and told the kitchen to make my order first. My order literally came out in like one minute lol! Will be back for more!

Just like the one back home at ward center. I absolutely love it, very fresh and makes me feel like I'm back at home. The death of me is the bakery...I can eat one of everything! The ube---ONOLICIOUS!

So good, I came back for a second visit - and it won't be my last!

Best Poke in area.  I've seen new Poke or sushi burrito spots pop up around town, and they're good, but the quality, creativity, and authenticity of Paina stands out from the rest. I feel like I've locked in my go-to spot for this dish, and let me tell you why...

Great location: It's right at the intersection of two major streets, Rainbow and Spring Mountain (NE corner). Plus, there's a huge lot, so parking is never an issue.

Authentic atmosphere: I haven't stepped into the adjacent businesses, but I can say Paina's got the cleanest, patron friendly, comfortable environment.  It's all attributed to the Hawaiian music in the background, Disney's Lilo & Stitch playing on the tv's, USB outlets for your charging needs, and all the simple Hawaiian decorations that all exist to transport you to the islands. (It all makes sense too, because this Vegas location is their first mainland venture after years of business in Honolulu)

Friendly staff: Now I haven't been to Hawaii in a while, but I know the moment your plane touches down there, you're welcomed with a smile by the community.  It's no different at Paina. The owner (I've met one of them), individuals taking your order, and preparing your meal execute a fantastic dining experience whether dining in or taking it to go.

THE FOOD: So delicious. On this visit I went with my first choice, Hawaiian Poke Bowl ($9.95) which is simply choice of poke (I chose Spicy Tuna), along with Lomi (a type of salted) Salmon and Kalua pork, over choice of white or brown rice.  Customize it more with several choices of toppings for $.60 each - I added shredded nori (seaweed) and furikake (chopped sesame, and more nori seasoning). And it was oh, so good.  

I want to also mention, on my first visit I had the one of Paina's signatures, the Kimura Ahi Katsu Bowl ($10.25) and today tried my friends Poke Crunch Bowl ($9.95), another signature bowl, and both were so good it's tough to choose a favorite.

To top it off, they have these recognitions from the Hawaiian community:

One of "The 17 Most Important Restaurants In Honolulu"
- Thrillist.com, on July 27, 2015
One of "America's most amazing meals for $10 or less" 
- Cheap Tickets in 2015.  
"Hawaii's favorite poke" in 2016
- featured on OC16's television show, 6 Picks, and selected by Hawaii celebrity hosts

The poke crunch bowl is good. Unless you're starving, a smaller bowl will suffice--I was fairly hungry and I could not finish the large. It's tasty--decent quality tuna with a nice, not-overwhelming seasoning. The folks working are friendly, and explained several items to me and answered my questions. The wi-fi didn't seem to be working.

great friendly customer service. chill relaxing atmosphere with reggae playing which adds to a more chill spot to enjoy a deliciously crafted fresh poke. if you grab some of their delicious poke try their shoyu garlic. it is amazing, sweet pickled garlic is heaven for garlic lovers. you cant go wrong with the Hawaiian style their popular one and so far my favorite their spice tuna is glorious. they also have Hawaiian style desserts which look so good but i havent had the chance to try.  must try if your looking for some killer poke..

Awesome Hawaiian food and the best poke we've ever had!  Small little restaurant with lots of poke love located near Greenland Market (Korean market) at the corner of Spring Mountain Road and Rainbow Blvd.  Parking is right in front of the restaurant.  The restaurant was pretty empty when we arrived for lunch but started to fill up as we were ordering.  We ordered at the cashier and when the food was ready, we picked up our food and brought it to our table.  

We ordered:
Hawaiian Poke Bowl with brown rice, Salmon Poke, Kalua pig and Lomi Salmon - a mixture of raw and cooked items.  Sis liked it.  I had a taste of her Kalua pig and it was good!
Nanea Salmon Poke Bowl with brown rice, shoyu ginger salmon poke with lemon citrus aioli, red onions, radish sprouts, masago and shredded nori. - I ate this poke bowl and loved it!  
Kalua Pig Bowl with white rice and signature shoyu poke sauce drizzled on rice - this was good.well-received by my parents.
Hawaiian Beef Bowl with white rice drizzled with teri glaze blend, thinly sliced beef simmered in shoyu poke onion broth served with potato salad and topped with crispy garlic and green onions - it was also well-received by my aunt.

But what was the best was the poke, for sure!  Especially the salmon poke - a must try!

Mahalo, Paina Café!

This is probably the best place I've been to for a poke bowl. Went here based off of some recommendations and it definitely did not disappoint. We both got regular size Hawaiian bowls with ahi, salmon lomi, and kalua pig over rice. We also ordered two spam musubis because we were feeling greedy. 

The bowls looked small coming out but they were packed with fish and meat! Everything was flavorful and delicious. I never thought of having kalua pig in my poke bowl, but it was ono. Salmon lomi was very good too, but very little salmon and mostly tomato. Fine for me, but hubby likes a little more fish in his lomi than tomatoes. Spam musubis were the bomb! Seems like they seasoned the rice with some furikake making it extra flavorful. 

They also have a large array of desserts, but we didn't get to that since we were so full. They did look beautiful though, I will definitely try to save room cor next time. It's a little more pricey here than other poke bowl places like Sweet Poke, but worth it for quality food that is actually Hawaiian style.

I wanted to give this place a try bc they one back home in Hawaii. This was my first time ever trying Paina Cafe. 

Store (5/5)
Very simple & cute decor. The store had lots of seating and was neat and clean.

Customer Service (4/5)
The employees were ok but could work more on explaining the menu since it was my first time... or been more friendly. But overall they were ok.

Food (5/5)
I ordered the Hawaiian bowl with shoyu poke & my bf ordered the same but with spicy ahi. Their kalua pork was super delicious & paired perfect with their Lomi salmon. Their shoyu poke however lacked flavor. I had to drown mines in shoyu for added flavor. But their spicy ahi was yummy!! The portion was small. It was more 80% rice & 20% everything else.... 

Overall, I would come again but maybe just buying poke by the pound.

Original Hawaiian poke is here in Las Vegas now! Their Ahi Katsu from the family recipe is something that I unheard of before and it was delicious. My favorite is the spicy tuna poke crunch with brown rice. Paina Cafe has a convenient access from Spring Mountain and has more variety of healthy options than any other poke restaurants. I've already become a regular visiting for their healthy option at lease 2-3 times a week.

I saw this place as I was driving by and decided to stop in and try it. I'm so glad I did it's amazing and most importantly fresh! I had the poke crunch bowl with brown rice and the poke I chose was Hawaiian Style poke. I got a small but I should have gotten a large lol! The people are nice, the place is clean and the music takes you to the islands! I will be back!!!!

Well this place was certainly worth the trip across town! After a long day of meetings I was ready for some poké. Paina Café delivered and then some. 

They are tucked away in a complex and you could blink and miss it if you aren't looking for it. I was looking for it and even I almost couldn't find it, but I wasn't wearing my glasses. 

The space was empty except for two women ahead of me in line. Once it was my turn to order I needed a moment and the gentleman totally obliged. A young woman ended up taking my order and she was with me every step of the way. She talked me into the California bowl and I added spicy tuna. Next time I will do without the pickles and roe but the avocado and crab were delicious. I'm obsessed. 

They have spam musubi and it was pretty tasty! They were down to two and she gave me the last one on the house. Their dessert case is awesome too. Ube flat roll, Ube cream puff, Ube tart, Ube custard pies. I was in Ube heaven. 

Aloha.

Man. This place has got to be the closest thing to REAL island food lol haven't tried everything. But we had the chicken katsu and poke bowl and my husband loved it! He even said the Kalua pig in his poke bowl was kind of weird but when he started eating it, he ate it all! Lol. Even tho the chicken katsu didn't look like zippys it is definitely the best out here in the mainland! I mean portions and taste. The salad was different but still good. Thanks for the ono local food, we will be eating here more often lol. My husband also tells me he thinks you guys have Chantilly cupcakes!? Been craving Hawaiian Chantilly since we moved here last year! Lol need to check that out!

Let me start by saying that its been almost a year since we moved to Vegas and ONLY NOW we found this gem. My husband and i are PICKY when it comes to our food. We only eat out sometimes unless its a spot we love. And we havent found that here. More so because its lacking one thing more than the other. Until we tried Pa'ina cafe that is...

Lets start with customer service: 

EXCELLENT - they were open on easter! Amazing. Gave them a phone call to see if their hours changed and the girl over the phone said that their hours were the same. Super impressed. We took the drive and when we arrived, we were warmly greeted (just like back at home!) 
I was so excited and she didnt seem uninterested in my excitement and gave me GREAT poke recommendations. 

Food - high quality, PACKED! Two plates of their teri chicken all rice fed all four of my kiddos with a little extra for my toddler. Poke was PRIME we ate at poke express had other pokes here in LV but this took us back home big time. Big props to their cube size poke too. Impressed with everything!!!!! I also bought their tartes. That is also amazing!!!! Im not sharing with anyone haha. 

Oh and they have hawaiian sun juice  

AMBIENCE - oh my gosh, simplicity but local style at its finest. Very clean lots of room. 

Over all i'll be back hopefully weekly for this especially since its right up the road from our house. We received a warm welcome and a warm goodbye from the whole staff. Thank you Pa'ina cafe for making our easter AMAZING!!!

The best poke bowl spot in LV, hands down! I ordered the Hawaiian bowl, which comes with kalua pork and Lomi salmon. I savored each and every bite, I had one half for lunch and saved the other half for dinner. They have a good selection of dessert that I'd like to try on my next visit. This place will be my go to for my poke bowl fix.
